sparql:
# This query lists distinct named graphs available in the LiITA endpoint, which contains Italian linguistic resources modeled with OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?g  # Select distinct graph names (IRIs) that are currently in the dataset
WHERE { 
  GRAPH ?g { ?s ?p ?o }  # For each named graph ?g, match any triple (?s ?p ?o), ensuring the graph is not empty
}
LIMIT 10  # Limit the result to 10 named graphs to avoid excessive output
nl: List all named graphs in the endpoint

nl_variants.generic: Show me all the named data collections available in the Italian linguistic database.
nl_variants.linguist: Provide a list of all the distinct named datasets or corpora currently represented in the Italian lexical resource.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the distinct named graphs present in the LiITA endpoint, which contains resources modeled with OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies, by querying for any existing triples within each named graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to list the names of all the distinct named graphs in the LiITA knowledge base endpoint. Named graphs are used here to organize and separate different subsets of Italian linguistic data. The query checks which graphs contain at least one triple, ensuring they are not empty, and returns their identifiers up to a limit of ten.

sparql:
# This query counts the total number of Lemma resources in the main LiITA graph using OntoLex-Lemon and LILA ontology terms

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>         # LILA ontology prefix, defines linguistic concepts like Lemma
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>    # OntoLex-Lemon core vocabulary for lexical resources
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>          # Lexicon Model for Ontologies, complementing OntoLex
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>  # OntoLex vocabulary for variant and translational relations
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>      # SKOS vocabulary for concept schemes, used in lexical semantics
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>              # Dublin Core Metadata Terms, for metadata annotations
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>     # RDF Schema vocabulary for general RDF terms including classes and properties
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>  # LexInfo ontology for linguistically detailed lexical properties
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> # Basic RDF syntax namespace

SELECT (COUNT(?lemma) AS ?count)      # Select the count of all ?lemma resources as ?count
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {       # Querying the main LiITA named graph containing lexical data
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .              # ?lemma is an instance of lila:Lemma representing a lemma in LiITA Lemma Bank
  } 
}
LIMIT 10                              # Limit result set to 10 (though only one result is expected due to COUNT)
nl: Count the total number of Lemmas in the main LiITA graph

nl_variants.generic: How many lemmas are there in the main LiITA dataset?
nl_variants.linguist: What is the total count of lemma entries recorded in the principal LiITA lexicon?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the total number of instances of the class lila:Lemma within the named graph http://liita.it/data of the LiITA ontology, using OntoLex-Lemon and LILA vocabularies.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find out how many lemmas—base word forms—are present in the main LiITA graph. It does so by counting all resources typed as lila:Lemma in the LiITA lexical dataset.

sparql:
# This query explores predicates (?p) used to describe Lemma instances in the LiITA knowledge base, utilizing OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?p
WHERE { 
  # Query is run on the named graph for LiITA data, isolating it from other data sources.
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Pattern matches any resource typed as lila:Lemma (an OntoLex lexical entry for Lemma in LiITA).
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Retrieves predicates (?p) used to describe the lemma instance 
           # where ?o is any object connected to the lemma by ?p.
           ?p ?o .
  } 
}
# Limits the output to 10 unique predicates to sample predicates describing Lemma
LIMIT 10
nl: Explore predicates used to describe a Lemma

nl_variants.generic: What are some of the properties or attributes used to describe a lemma in the LiITA Italian linguistic database?
nl_variants.linguist: Which predicates are employed to characterize Lemma instances within the LiITA lexicon, indicating the types of linguistic or lexical information linked to each lemma?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve a sample of distinct predicates used as properties for instances of the class lila:Lemma within the named graph <http://liita.it/data> in the LiITA knowledge base, which conforms to the OntoLex-Lemon model for lexical data representation.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query is intended to identify various properties (predicates) that are used to describe lemma entries in the LiITA database. By exploring these predicates, one can understand what kinds of linguistic or metadata information are attached to lemma instances in this Italian lexical resource.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all distinct Part-of-Speech (POS) tags used in lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base using the lila:hasPOS property.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?pos
WHERE { 
  # Query the named graph containing LiITA Lemma Bank data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Select lemmas linked to their POS tags via the lila:hasPOS property
    # In the OntoLex-Lemon model, lemmas represent lexical entries
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS ?pos .
  } 
}
LIMIT 10  # Limit results to 10 distinct POS tags to avoid overly large results
nl: List all distinct Part-of-Speech (POS) tags used

nl_variants.generic: Show me all unique part-of-speech tags that appear in the Italian lemmatized data.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the distinct POS categories assigned to lemmas within the Italian lexical resource.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all distinct POS tags associated with lemmas in the LiITA knowledge base by querying the lila:hasPOS property within the <http://liita.it/data> named graph, conforming to the OntoLex-Lemon model.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This request aims to list all the different part-of-speech tags used to classify lemmas in the LiITA dataset, by looking up the lila:hasPOS property that links each lemma to its POS tag. It helps understand which grammatical categories are represented in the lexical resource.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base whose written representation ends with the suffix "-mente", typically indicating adverbs in Italian.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Querying within the LiITA dataset named graph
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;                # Find resources typed as Lemma in lila ontology (LiITA lexical entries)
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .      # Get the written representation (lemma form) as a string literal
    # Filter lemmas whose writtenRep ends with "mente" indicating common Italian adverbial suffix
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "mente$")
  } 
}
LIMIT 50  # Limit to 50 results to restrict output size
nl: Find lemmas ending with the suffix "-mente" (likely adverbs)

nl_variants.generic: Find Italian lemmas whose spelling ends with the suffix '-mente', which usually indicates adverbs.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lexical entries (lemmas) whose canonical form ends with the suffix '-mente', a common marker for adverbs in Italian.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base for resources of type lila:Lemma that have an ontolex:writtenRep ending with the string 'mente' within the named graph <http://liita.it/data>, to extract lemmas likely representing Italian adverbs according to their morphological suffix.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for Italian lemmas whose written forms end with the suffix '-mente'. In Italian, this suffix typically marks adverbs, so extracting these lemmas helps identify adverbial words in the dataset.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank whose written representations start with the prefix "anti-".
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Select resources typed as lila:Lemma, representing lexical entries (lemmas) in LiITA.
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Access the canonical written representation (form) of the lemma using ontolex:writtenRep.
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Use FILTER with regex to match lemmas whose written form starts with "anti".
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^anti")
  } 
}
# Limit the result set to 50 matches to avoid excessive output.
LIMIT 50
nl: Find lemmas starting with the prefix "anti-"

nl_variants.generic: List all Italian lemmas that begin with the prefix "anti-".
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all lemmas in the Italian lexical database whose canonical forms start with the prefix "anti-".
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge graph for resources of class lila:Lemma that have an ontolex:writtenRep beginning with the string "anti", retrieving up to 50 such lexical entries represented in the OntoLex-Lemon model.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find all lemmas in the LiITA lexical resource that have a canonical written form starting with the prefix "anti-". It searches for lexical entries classified as lemmas and filters their standard written representations to only those that begin with "anti", returning a maximum of 50 results.

sparql:
# This query retrieves very long words (potential compounds) from the LiITA Lemma Bank by selecting lemmas with written representations longer than 18 characters, ordered by string length descending. 

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr (STRLEN(str(?wr)) AS ?len)  # Select the written representation and compute its length
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {  # Query the LiITA data graph containing linguistic resources
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;  # Find resources typed as lila:Lemma (lemmas are canonical lexical entries in LiITA)
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .  # Get their written form, as per OntoLex-Lemon's writtenRep property
    FILTER (STRLEN(str(?wr)) > 18)  # Filter words with string length greater than 18, identifying very long words (possible compounds)
  } 
}
ORDER BY DESC(?len)  # Order results descending by length of the written representation
LIMIT 20  # Return only the top 20 longest words
nl: Identify very long words (potential compounds)

nl_variants.generic: Find very long Italian words, likely compound words, that have more than 18 characters.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lemmas whose orthographic representations exceed 18 characters in length, potentially identifying compounds or complex lexical forms.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base graph for OntoLex-Lemon lexicon entries of type lila:Lemma, extracting their ontolex:writtenRep with string length greater than 18 characters, to obtain a ranked list of very long lexical units, possibly compounds.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for Italian words recorded in the LiITA lexical resource that are exceptionally long, specifically those with more than 18 characters in their written form. Such long words are often compound words or complex formations, so identifying them helps study Italian word formation.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that have multiple written representations (variants), leveraging the OntoLex-Lemon model to count different written forms per lemma.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma (COUNT(?wr) as ?variantCount)
# Select each lemma and count how many different written representations (?wr) it has
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Query over the LiITA dataset graph where linguistic data is stored
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
    # ?lemma is an instance of the class lila:Lemma, representing a lexical entry root in LiITA
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Retrieve all written representations (?wr) linked to the lemma via the ontolex:writtenRep property
  } 
}
GROUP BY ?lemma
# Group results by lemma to aggregate counts of written representations
HAVING (COUNT(?wr) > 1)
# Filter to only include lemmas that have more than one written form, i.e., lemmas with spelling variants
LIMIT 50
# Limit the output to 50 lemmas for manageability
nl: Find lemmas with multiple written representations (Variants)

nl_variants.generic: List Italian lemmas that have more than one written form or variant.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lexical entries (lemmas) that are associated with multiple orthographic variants or written representations in the lexicon.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge graph to find all instances of the class lila:Lemma that link to multiple distinct ontolex:writtenRep nodes, thereby identifying lemmas with more than one written representation variant according to the OntoLex-Lemon model.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Identify Italian lemmas in the LiITA dataset that have multiple different written forms, which means they appear with more than one spelling variant or orthographic representation in the lexical resource.

sparql:
# Retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base whose written representation contains the substring "geo"

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  # Querying the named graph for LiITA data where linguistic lexical entries are stored
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # ?lemma is an instance of lila:Lemma, representing a lexical entry (lemma) in LiITA
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Retrieve the written form (representation) of the lemma using OntoLex's property
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter to only include lemmas whose written representation contains the substring "geo" (case-insensitive)
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "geo", "i")
  } 
}
# Limits the output to the first 50 matches to control result size
LIMIT 50
nl: Retrieve lemmas containing the substring "geo"

nl_variants.generic: Find lemmas that include the substring "geo" anywhere in their written form.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian lemmas whose orthographic form contains the sequence of characters "geo".
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA dataset for all instances of the class lila:Lemma where the ontolex:writtenRep property matches a case-insensitive regular expression containing "geo", selecting up to 50 such lemmas from the named graph <http://liita.it/data>.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query retrieves lexical entries, called lemmas, from the LiITA knowledge base that have the substring "geo" appearing anywhere in their written representation. The goal is to find all lemmas containing these characters regardless of case, up to a limit of 50 results, allowing users to explore Italian lemmas related to or containing this sequence.

sparql:
# Counts the number of lemmas classified as verbs in the LiITA Lemma Bank using the lila:hasPOS property within the LiITA data graph.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT (COUNT(?lemma) AS ?verbCount)
WHERE { 
  # Querying the named graph where LiITA linguistic data is stored
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Matching lemmas that are linked to a part of speech 'verb' via the lila:hasPOS property
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:verb .
  } 
}
# Limiting the output to 10 results (though COUNT will return a single binding)
LIMIT 10
nl: Count the number of Verbs

nl_variants.generic: How many verbs are there in the Italian lemma dataset?
nl_variants.linguist: Provide the total count of lemmas categorized as verbs in the Italian lexical resource.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the total number of lemmas classified with the part of speech 'verb' using the lila:hasPOS property within the LiITA dataset graph (<http://liita.it/data>), based on OntoLex-Lemon modeling.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query is intended to count all lemmas in the LiITA Italian lexical database that are annotated as verbs, using the property that specifies their part of speech.

sparql:
# This query retrieves up to 50 noun lemmas (their written representations) from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon and LiLa ontologies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  # Target the named graph that contains the LiITA data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Find ?lemma instances that have a part of speech specified as noun by the LiLa ontology
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:noun ;
           # Get the corresponding written canonical form of the lemma from OntoLex property
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
  } 
}
LIMIT 50  # Limit results to the first 50 noun lemma forms found
nl: Find all nouns

nl_variants.generic: List up to 50 nouns from the Italian lexical database.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the canonical written forms of up to fifty lemmas classified as nouns in the Italian lexical resource.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Select up to 50 lemmas from the LiITA dataset in the <http://liita.it/data> named graph, where each lemma is typed with the property lila:hasPOS as lila:noun, retrieving their canonical forms via ontolex:writtenRep, according to the OntoLex-Lemon and LiLa ontologies.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query obtains a list of up to fifty noun lemmas from the Italian linguistic knowledge base called LiITA by identifying those entries marked with the part of speech 'noun' and extracting their standard written forms. It shows how to access lexical information about nouns stored in this resource.

sparql:
# Retrieve adjectives from the LiITA Lemma Bank whose written forms end with the suffix "-ile".

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  # Restrict search to the LiITA data graph containing Italian linguistic resources
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Select lemmas with part of speech 'adjective' using the lila ontology predicate lila:hasPOS
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:adjective ;
           # Retrieve the main written representation (lemma form) of the lexical entry per ontolex
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter to keep only adjectives whose written form ends with the string "ile"
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "ile$")
  } 
}
# Limit to 50 results to avoid excessively large output sets
LIMIT 50
nl: Find Adjectives ending in "-ile"

nl_variants.generic: Find Italian adjectives that end with the suffix '-ile'.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian adjectives whose lemma forms terminate with the suffix '-ile'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexicographic dataset for lexical entries typed as adjectives in the lila:adjective class, extracting their ontolex:writtenRep representations whose strings end with the suffix 'ile' within the <http://liita.it/data> named graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to identify adjectives in Italian whose canonical written forms end with the suffix '-ile'. It does this by searching within the LiITA linguistic dataset for lexical entries classified as adjectives and filtering the results to include only those whose lemma forms conclude with 'ile'.

sparql:
# This query counts the total number of lemma entries in the Sicilian Lemma Bank within the LiITA knowledge base.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT (COUNT(?lemma) AS ?count)  # Counting the total number of lemmas (?lemma) returned
WHERE { 
  # Pattern to find all lemmas that are part of the Sicilian Lemma Bank using the Dublin Core term isPartOf
  ?lemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
}
LIMIT 10  # Limit the result to 10, though for counting purposes typically not necessary; might be an accidental remnant or for safety in query execution
nl: Count total entries in the Sicilian Lemma Bank

nl_variants.generic: How many lemma entries are there in the Sicilian Lemma Bank?
nl_variants.linguist: What is the total number of lemmas contained in the Sicilian Lemma Bank within the Italian linguistic resource?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the count of all instances of the class ontolex:LexicalEntry that are linked via dcterms:isPartOf to the Sicilian Lemma Bank resource in the LiITA graph, effectively determining the total number of Sicilian lemmas represented in the OntoLex-Lemon based dataset.

sparql:
# Retrieves Sicilian nouns from the LiITA Lemma Bank whose written form starts with "z"

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  # Select lemmas that are part of the Sicilian Dialect Lemma Bank in LiITA
  ?lemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> ;
         # Assert that the lemma has part of speech noun according to lila ontology
         lila:hasPOS lila:noun ;
         # Retrieve the written representation of the lemma (string form)
         ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
  # Filter to keep only lemmas whose written representation starts with "z" (case-insensitive)
  FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^z", "i")
}
LIMIT 20  # Return at most 20 results to limit output size
nl: Sicilian nouns starting with "z"

nl_variants.generic: Which Sicilian nouns start with the letter 'z'?
nl_variants.linguist: Provide a list of noun lemmas in Sicilian whose orthographic form begins with the letter 'z'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve Sicilian lemmas classified as nouns in the LiITA Dialetto Siciliano Lemma Bank, selecting their ontolex:writtenRep values where these lexical forms start with 'z' (case-insensitive), using the lila:hasPOS property to ensure the part of speech is noun.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find Sicilian nouns by extracting lemmas from the LiITA dataset that belong to the Sicilian dialect and whose written lexical representation starts with the letter 'z'. This helps identify lexical items classified as nouns beginning with 'z' in Sicilian.

sparql:
# Retrieve Sicilian words from the LiITA Lemma Bank that end with the letter "u" (typical masculine ending) using OntoLex-Lemon representation

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  # ?lemma is a lexical entry which belongs to the Sicilian lemma bank in LiITA, identified by the dcterms:isPartOf predicate
  ?lemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> ;
         # Retrieve the written representation (string form) of the lexical entry using ontolex:writtenRep
         ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
  # Filter lexical entries to only those whose written representation ends with "u" (regex anchors "$" for end of string)
  FILTER regex(str(?wr), "u$")
}
LIMIT 20
# Limit the results to 20 matching Sicilian words ending in "u"
nl: Sicilian words ending in "u" (Typical masculine ending)

nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve from the LiITA dataset all lemmas linked via dcterms:isPartOf to the Sicilian lemma bank, whose ontolex:writtenRep literal values end with the character 'u', indicating typical masculine morphological endings, using SPARQL over OntoLex-Lemon modeled lexical entries.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find Sicilian words stored in the LiITA lexical resource that end with the letter 'u'. This query focuses on identifying typical masculine endings in the Sicilian dialect by filtering entries based on their written forms.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the Sicilian Dialect Lemma Bank in LiITA that have identical written representations in both Sicilian and Italian, demonstrating cross-lingual lemma matching in the LiITA OntoLex-Lemon lexical resources.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT STR(?wr) AS ?wr ?lemma ?liitaLemma
WHERE {
  # Select lemmas that belong to the Sicilian Dialect Lemma Bank in LiITA 
  ?lemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
  
  # Get the written representation of the Sicilian lemma (string form)
  ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
  
  # Find the lexical entry (?le) that has this lemma as its canonical form according to OntoLex-Lemon
  ?le ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  
  # Find an Italian lexical entry (?leITA) that is related to the Sicilian entry via translatableAs relation from vartrans vocabulary
  ?leITA vartrans:translatableAs ?le ;
         ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma .
  
  # Get the written representation of the Italian lemma
  ?liitaLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIT .

  # Filter to ensure the Sicilian and Italian written forms are exactly identical strings
  FILTER( STR(?wr) = STR(?wrIT) )
  
}
LIMIT 10
# Limit result to 10 matches to prevent large result sets
nl: Comparison: Lemmas that exist identically in both Italian and Sicilian

nl_variants.generic: Which lemmas have the exact same written form in both the Italian and Sicilian languages?
nl_variants.linguist: Identify lemmas included in the Sicilian Dialect Lemma Bank that share an identical orthographic form with corresponding lemmas in Italian, indicating cross-lingual lemma equivalence.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve lemmas from the LiITA ontology that are part of the Sicilian Dialect Lemma Bank and have identical OntoLex canonicalForm written representations to lemmas in Italian lexical entries, linked via the vartrans:translatableAs property within the OntoLex-Lemon framework.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find lemmas recorded in the Sicilian Dialect Lemma Bank that have the same exact written representation as lemmas in the Italian lexical entries. This helps show which words are spelled identically across the two languages in the LiITA lexical dataset.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Parmigiano dialect translations for the Italian word "casa" from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon lexical structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wrIta ?wr ?liitaLemma ?parmigianoLemma
WHERE {
    # ?liitaLemma is a canonical form (lemma) in the Italian lexicon with its written representation ?wrIta
    ?liitaLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta .

    # ?leItaLexiconPar is a lexical entry that has the Italian lemma as its canonical form,
    # ^lime:entry <...> uses inverse property to select lexical entries in the Parmigiano dialect lexicon within LiITA
    # vartrans:translatableAs links this Italian lexical entry to a Parmigiano lexical entry (?leParLexiconPar)
    ?leItaLexiconPar
      ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma ;
      ^lime:entry <http://liita.it/data/id/LexicalReources/DialettoParmigiano/Lexicon> ;
      vartrans:translatableAs ?leParLexiconPar .

    # Retrieve the canonical form of the Parmigiano lexical entry and its written representation
    ?leParLexiconPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?parmigianoLemma .
    ?parmigianoLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .

    # Filter to match Italian lemma written representation exactly to "casa"
    FILTER( STR(?wrIta) = "casa" )
}
LIMIT 100
nl: Find Parmigiano translations for the Italian word "casa" (house)

nl_variants.generic: What are the translations of the Italian word "casa" in the Parmigiano dialect?
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the lexical equivalents in the Parmigiano dialect corresponding to the Italian lemma "casa".
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base to find Parmigiano dialect lexical entries linked via vartrans:translatableAs to the Italian lemma "casa" in the OntoLex-Lemon lexical graph, retrieving their canonical forms and written representations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find the Parmigiano dialect translations for the Italian word "casa" by exploring the lexical resources in LiITA. It specifically looks for the canonical Italian lemma "casa" and then identifies the Parmigiano lexical entries that are marked as translations of that Italian word.

sparql:
# This query retrieves up to 10 Italian lemmas and their corresponding canonical forms translated into Parmigiano dialect from the LiITA knowledge base Lexicon of Dialetto Parmigiano using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT *
WHERE {
    # ?leIta is an Italian lemma that has a translation relation (vartrans:translatableAs) to a Parmigiano lemma ?lePar
    ?leIta vartrans:translatableAs ?lePar .

    # Pull out the canonical written representation of the Italian lemma (OntoLex canonicalForm/ writtenRep)
    ?leIta ontolex:canonicalForm/ontolex:writtenRep ?itaWord .

    # Pull out the canonical written representation of the Parmigiano lemma (OntoLex canonicalForm/ writtenRep)
    ?lePar ontolex:canonicalForm/ontolex:writtenRep ?parWord .

    # Restrict the Parmigiano lemma (?lePar) to entries belonging to the Parmigiano dialect lexicon in LiITA,
    # using the inverse property (^lime:entry) pointing from lemma to the lexicon resource
    ?lePar ^lime:entry <http://liita.it/data/id/LexicalReources/DialettoParmigiano/Lexicon>
}
LIMIT 10
nl: List all available translations in Parmigiano

nl_variants.generic: Show me the list of Italian words and their translations available in the Parmigiano dialect.
nl_variants.linguist: Provide a list of Italian lemmas along with their canonical forms translated into the Parmigiano dialect, as recorded in the Parmigiano lexicon.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve up to 10 Italian lemmas (?leIta) that have vartrans:translatableAs relations to Parmigiano lemmas (?lePar) within the LiITA knowledge base, extracting their canonical forms' written representations from OntoLex-Lemon lexical entries, where the Parmigiano lemmas belong to the Parmigiano dialect lexicon identified by the lexicon URI in LiITA.
nl_variants.pedagogical: List up to ten Italian words along with their corresponding canonical written forms that have translations in the Parmigiano dialect, by accessing the lexical data from the LiITA database. Specifically, this involves identifying Italian lemmas connected to Parmigiano lemmas through translation relations and retrieving their main written forms defined for both languages.

sparql:
# This query retrieves the definition(s) of the Italian lemma "gatto" from the CompL-it resource in the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>  # OntoLex namespace for linguistic ontologies, including Lemmas, Forms, and Senses
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>  # SKOS used here for definitions attached to senses
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?definition  # Select the definition linked to the sense of the lemma "gatto"
WHERE {
    SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {  # Query the CompL-it specific endpoint within LiITA

            ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] ;  # ?word is a lexical entry with a canonical written form ?wrIta

                    ontolex:sense [ skos:definition ?definition ] .  # The lexical entry has one or more senses that have definitions

        FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "gatto" ) .  # Filter lexical entries whose canonical form is exactly "gatto"
  }
}
LIMIT 10  # Limit results to at most 10 definitions
nl: Find definition of "gatto" from CompL-it

nl_variants.generic: What is the definition of the Italian word "gatto" according to the CompL-it lexical resource?
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the semantic definition(s) associated with the Italian lemma "gatto" as recorded in the CompL-it lexicon.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the skos:definition literals linked to the ontolex:sense nodes of the ontolex:LexicalEntry with a canonicalForm equal to "gatto" in the CompL-it named graph accessed via LiITA, using the OntoLex-Lemon model for lexical data.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find the meanings or definitions provided for the canonical Italian lemma "gatto" in the CompL-it lexical dataset, which is accessed through the LiITA platform. This involves looking up the main form of the word and retrieving the definitions attached to its sense(s).

sparql:
# This query retrieves hyponyms of the Italian lemma "veicolo" from the LiITA Lemma Bank, leveraging OntoLex-Lemon semantic relations to find more specific lexical senses linked by hypernymy.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?hyponymWord
WHERE {
    SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
        # Select words (?word) having a canonical lexical form with an Italian written representation (?wrIta)
        ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] .

        # Filter to restrict to the lemma "veicolo"
        FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "veicolo" ) .

        # Get the lexical sense(s) associated with ?word
        ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .

        # Use lexinfo:hypernym relation from the sense to find more general senses (?hypoSense)
        # Actually, this is reversed: hyponyms are those linked by the hypernym relation in the opposite direction
        # Here, ?sense lexinfo:hypernym ?hypoSense means ?sense has a hypernym ?hypoSense,
        # so the query finds senses (?hypoSense) that are hypernyms of the sense of "veicolo"
        # and then looks for words with that hypernym sense, resulting in hyponyms of "veicolo"
        ?sense lexinfo:hypernym ?hypoSense .

        # Find words (?hypoWord) that have the ?hypoSense (the hypernym sense of "veicolo")
        # and retrieve their canonical written form representations (?hyponymWord)
        ?hypoWord ontolex:sense ?hypoSense ;
              ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?hyponymWord ] .
    }
}
LIMIT 10
nl: Find Hyponyms of "veicolo" (vehicle); Find all words that are more specific than "veicolo" (i.e., hyponyms)

nl_variants.generic: List all words in Italian that are more specific types or subcategories of the word "veicolo" (vehicle).
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the hyponyms of the Italian lemma "veicolo," that is, all lexical items whose meanings are semantically more specific than "veicolo."
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon to extract lexical entries whose senses are linked as hyponyms to the lemma "veicolo" by means of the lexinfo:hypernym property, identifying all lexical entities with canonical forms representing subtypes of "veicolo."
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find all Italian lexical items that are hyponyms of the lemma "veicolo," meaning all words that denote more specific categories or instances of vehicles. It does so by exploring the semantic hierarchy of lexical senses in the LiITA database, using hypernymy relations to identify words whose meanings fall under the broader concept of "veicolo."

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian meronyms (parts) of the lemma "corpo" from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?partWord ?sense
WHERE {
  # Query runs against an external SPARQL endpoint of LiITA lemma bank
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    
    # Retrieve a lemma ?word with a canonical form whose written representation (?wrIta) is "corpo"
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] ;
          ontolex:sense ?sense .
    # Filter to select only the lemma "corpo" in Italian
    FILTER( STR(?wrIta) = "corpo" ) .
    
    # Retrieve meronym senses (?partSense) that are partMeronyms of the sense of "corpo"
    ?partSense lexinfo:partMeronym ?sense .
    
    # For each partSense get the lemma (?partLemma) with that sense and its canonical written form (?partWord)
    ?partLemma ontolex:sense ?partSense ;
               ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?partWord ] .
  }
}
LIMIT 10
# Limits output to 10 part words representing parts of the "corpo" lemma
nl: Find Meronyms of "corpo" (hand);  find all Italian words that represent parts of a 'corpo' (body)

nl_variants.generic: List Italian words that are parts of the word 'corpo' (body).
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the Italian lexical items that denote meronyms, or parts, of the lemma 'corpo'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon to find Italian lemmas whose senses are linked as partMeronyms to the sense of the lemma 'corpo', identifying the Italian lexical expressions that represent parts of 'corpo'.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find all Italian words that refer to parts or components of the concept expressed by the word 'corpo'. This means retrieving lexical entries that are meronyms of 'corpo', i.e., words that stand for its parts or subdivisions.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas and their definitions from the LiITA Lemma Bank where the definition contains the word "amore", using OntoLex-Lemon structures to access canonical forms and senses.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>  # OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary for lexical entries, forms, senses
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>  # SKOS vocabulary used here for definitions of senses
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma ?definition  # Select lemma (word form) and its skos:definition
WHERE {
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {  # Query the remote LiITA knowledge base SPARQL endpoint
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] ;  
      # Find lexical entries (?word) with a canonical form that has a written representation (?lemma)
    ontolex:sense [ skos:definition ?definition ] .  
      # Link the lexical entry to a sense that has a SKOS definition (?definition)
    FILTER regex(?definition, "amore", "i")  # Filter definitions containing "amore" case-insensitive
  }
}
LIMIT 20  # Limit results to 20 bindings
nl: Find words with "amore" in their definition

nl_variants.generic: Find words whose definitions include the term 'amore'.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve lexical entries from the Italian lexicon that have sense definitions containing the word 'amore'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical graph for OntoLex-Lemon lexical entries that have canonical forms with written representations, linked to senses whose SKOS definitions contain the string 'amore' (case-insensitive).
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for Italian words in the LiITA lexical database whose meanings, given by their definitions, mention the word 'amore'. It finds lemmas connected to senses annotated with definitions containing that term, helping to identify how the concept of 'love' is expressed in various lexical entries.

sparql:
# Count how many senses the word "piano" has in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT (COUNT(?sense) as ?senseCount)
WHERE {
  # Use the SPARQL SERVICE clause to query the remote LiITA knowledge base endpoint
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Find a lexical entry (?word) with a canonical form whose written representation is "piano"
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ 
      ontolex:writtenRep "piano"   # The lemma's written form (string) in OntoLex-Lemon
    ] ;
    # Retrieve all senses (?sense) linked to this lexical entry via ontolex:sense
          ontolex:sense ?sense .
  }
}
LIMIT 10
# LIMIT is set to 10 although counting senses does not require limiting results; 
# it might be a safeguard in query processing but is not strictly necessary here
nl: Count how many senses the word "piano" has

nl_variants.generic: How many different meanings does the word "piano" have?

sparql:
# Retrieves distinct properties and their graphs related to the Emotion Lexicon (ELIta) from the LiITA knowledge base using SPARQL.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>  # LiLa ontology for linguistic & lexical annotations
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>  # OntoLex-Lemon core vocabulary for lexical entries
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>  # Lemon IT Metadata extension
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>  # Lemon vocabulary for variation and translation relations
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>  # SKOS for knowledge organization systems
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>  # Dublin Core terms for metadata descriptions
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>  # RDF Schema vocabulary for basic vocabularies
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>  # LexInfo ontology for morphosyntactic info
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>  # RDF syntax namespace

SELECT DISTINCT ?g ?p  # Select unique graph URI and property URI
WHERE {
  GRAPH ?g {  # Query in named graph ?g - allows targeting specific subsets of LiITA data
    ?s ?p ?o .  # Matches any triple pattern in graph ?g (subject ?s, predicate ?p, object ?o)
  }
  FILTER regex(str(?g), "elita", "i")  # Filters graphs whose URI string matches "elita" case-insensitively, targeting the Emotion Lexicon (ELIta)
}
LIMIT 10  # Limits results to 10 to avoid flooding with too many triples
nl: Explore properties of the Emotion Lexicon (ELIta)

nl_variants.generic: What are the properties associated with the Emotion Lexicon (ELIta) in the LiITA knowledge base?
nl_variants.linguist: Which distinct lexical or semantic properties are documented for the Emotion Lexicon (ELIta) within the LiITA resource?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve distinct predicates and their associated named graphs within the LiITA dataset where triples are stored, filtering those graphs related to the Emotion Lexicon (ELIta), as defined by the case-insensitive URI pattern, exploiting the OntoLex-Lemon and linked ontologies.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Identify and list the unique properties and their corresponding graphs found in the LiITA knowledge base that are connected to the Emotion Lexicon (ELIta). This helps understand what kinds of information and relationships are encoded about the ELIta lexicon within the linked linguistic data.

sparql:
# This query retrieves verbs from the LiITA Lemma Bank whose written forms end with "-ere" and orders them by ascending length.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Querying the named graph of LiITA Lemma Bank data
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:verb ;          # Select lexical entries that have POS tagged as verbs using lila vocabulary
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .          # Get the written representation of each verb (lemma form) as per OntoLex-Lemon model
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "ere$")           # Filter those written forms that end with the string "ere" using regex on their string value
  } 
}
ORDER BY ASC(STRLEN(str(?wr)))               # Order the results by ascending string length of the written representation
LIMIT 50                                     # Limit the output to 50 verbs only

nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lemma bank graph to extract lexical entries typed as verbs (pos:verb) according to the LiLa vocabulary, selecting their OntoLex-Lemon written representations that match the regex pattern ending in "ere", and order the results by ascending string length, limiting to 50 entries.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This request aims to obtain a list of Italian verbs from the LiITA lexical database where each verb's written form ends with "-ere". The verbs should be sorted from the shortest to the longest based on the number of characters in their lemma representation. sparql:
# This query counts the number of explicit translation relations (vartrans:translatableAs) in the LiITA Lemma Bank dataset using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>  # Vocabulary for lexical variation and translation links in OntoLex
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT (COUNT(*) as ?linkCount)  # Selects the total count of translation links
WHERE {
  ?s vartrans:translatableAs ?o .  # Matches all triples where a lexical entry or sense ?s has a translation relation to ?o
  # vartrans:translatableAs is used in OntoLex-Lemon to link lexical entries or senses to their translations
}
LIMIT 10  # Limits the result to 10 rows for efficiency, though count is single result here

sparql:
# This query retrieves definitions for Italian lemmas starting with "z" from the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex structures and integrates service data from an external SPARQL endpoint.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma ?definition
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Query within the LiITA named graph, which contains lemma entries
    ?liitaLemma a lila:Lemma ;                   # Select resources of type lila:Lemma specific to LiITA
                ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .      # Get the canonical written representation of the lemma (i.e., the word form)
    FILTER regex(?lemma, "^z", "i")                # Filter lemmas starting with "z" (case-insensitive) according to natural language requirement
  }
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Use SERVICE to fetch extra data (definitions) from an external SPARQL endpoint, leveraging federated querying
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] ;  # Match words whose canonical form's writtenRep matches ?lemma retrieved from LiITA
          ontolex:sense [ skos:definition ?definition ] .         # Extract the skos:definition from the associated sense object, representing word meaning
  }
}
LIMIT 20                                             # Limit results to 20 to avoid overly large result sets
nl: Retrieve definitions for Italian words starting with "z" (Service integration)

nl_variants.generic: Find definitions for Italian words that start with the letter 'z'.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the lexical definitions of Italian lemmas whose canonical forms begin with the letter 'z'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA dataset to extract Italian lemmas of type lila:Lemma starting with 'z', and use a federated SPARQL SERVICE to integrate their skos:definition values from an external OntoLex-Lemon compliant endpoint.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to obtain definitions for Italian words that begin with 'z' by first identifying lemmas in the LiITA lexicon and then integrating their meanings from another linked data service, showcasing how external lexical information can be combined for richer linguistic data.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that are verbs and have written representations ending with "rsi", indicating reflexive verbs.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  # Query data from the LiITA graph containing Italian lexical data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Select resources typed as Lemma in the LiLA ontology (lemma as a lexical entry)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Restrict to lemmas that have part of speech annotated as verb
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:verb .
    # Get the written representation (orthographic form) of the lemma using OntoLex ontolex:writtenRep property
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter lemma forms that end with "rsi" - typical ending of Italian reflexive verb infinitives (e.g., "lavarsi")
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "rsi$")
  }
}
# Order results by the written representation string
ORDER BY ?wr
# Limit output to 100 lemmas
LIMIT 100

sparql:
# This query counts the number of lemmas originating from each lexical resource in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>

SELECT ?resource (COUNT(?lemma) as ?count)
WHERE {
  # ?lemma is a lexical entry classified as a lemma in the LiITA database
  # dcterms:isPartOf connects each lemma to its lexical resource (e.g., a particular lexicon or lexical dataset)
  ?lemma dcterms:isPartOf ?resource .
}
# Group results by each lexical resource to count lemmas per resource
GROUP BY ?resource
# Order descending by count to get the resources with the most lemmas first
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
# Limit results to the top 10 lexical resources by lemma count
LIMIT 10
nl: How many lemmas come from each lexical resource in the knowledge base?

nl_variants.generic: How many lemmas are present in each lexical resource within the knowledge base?
nl_variants.linguist: What is the number of lemmas contributed by each lexical resource in the Italian lexical database?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the count of lexical entries classified as lemmas grouped by their lexical resource (identified via dcterms:isPartOf) within the LiITA knowledge graph, using the OntoLex-Lemon model, limiting to the top 10 resources by lemma count.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find out how many lemmas come from each lexical resource in the knowledge base. A lemma is a distinct lexical entry, and each lemma is linked to the lexical resource it belongs to. The query counts the lemmas per resource to see which resources contain the most lemmas, showing only the top ten lexical resources.

sparql:
# This query retrieves adjectives from the LiITA Lemma Bank whose written form ends with the suffix "-bile", indicating possibility.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Select resources typed as Lemma (core OntoLex concept representing canonical lexical entries)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Restrict lemmas to those with part of speech adjective according to LiITA ontology
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:adjective .
    # Get the canonical written representation of the lemma (OntoLex property)
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter lemmas with written form ending with suffix "bile" using regex on string value of ?wr
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "bile$")
  }
}
# Order results alphabetically by the written form
ORDER BY ?wr
# Limit output to top 10 matching adjectives
LIMIT 10

sparql:
# This query retrieves Sicilian terms corresponding to specified Italian kinship lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures and vartrans translation relations.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>

SELECT ?italianWord ?sicilianWord
WHERE {
  # Select Sicilian lexical entries by their canonical form (lemma)
  ?leSicilian ontolex:canonicalForm ?sicilianLemma .
  # Limit Sicilian lemmas to those that are part of the Sicilian dialect Lemma Bank in LiITA
  ?sicilianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
  # Get the written representation (string form) of the Sicilian lemma
  ?sicilianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?sicilianWord .

  # Link the Italian lemma to the Sicilian lemma via vartrans:translatableAs property (translation relation)
  ?leItalian vartrans:translatableAs ?leSicilian .
  # Get the canonical form (lemma) of the Italian lexical entry
  ?leItalian ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
  # Get the written representation (string) of the Italian lemma
  ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .

  # Filter only Italian kinship words: mother, father, brother, sister, son, daughter (form strings)
  FILTER (STR(?italianWord) IN ("madre", "padre", "fratello", "sorella", "figlio", "figlia"))
}
LIMIT 10
nl: What are the Sicilian terms for Italian kinship words (madre, padre, fratello, sorella)?

nl_variants.generic: What are the Sicilian words equivalent to the Italian kinship terms madre, padre, fratello, sorella, figlio, and figlia?
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the Sicilian lexical equivalents of the Italian kinship lemmas madre, padre, fratello, sorella, figlio, and figlia from the Sicilian dialect lexicon.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA Lemma Bank to obtain Sicilian lexical entries linked via vartrans:translatableAs to Italian kinship lemmas (madre, padre, fratello, sorella, figlio, figlia) using OntoLex-Lemon canonical forms and written representations, filtered to Sicilian dialect lemmas.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find the Sicilian terms corresponding to specific Italian kinship words—mother (madre), father (padre), brother (fratello), sister (sorella), son (figlio), and daughter (figlia)—by exploring lexical entries and their translations within the LiITA lexical resource, focusing on the Sicilian dialect equivalents.

sparql:
# This query retrieves up to 10 compound noun lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base whose written representation starts with "capo-".

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  # Specify the data graph containing LiITA lemma bank data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Match resources of type lila:Lemma representing lemmas in LiITA
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Filter lemmas to only nouns according to LiITA POS tagging
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:noun .
    # Get the lexical form (written representation) of the lemma from OntoLex-Lemon
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Use SPARQL FILTER with regex to find forms starting with "capo"
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^capo")
  }
}
# Order results alphabetically by the written representation
ORDER BY ?wr
# Limit output to 10 results to constrain result size
LIMIT 10

sparql:
# This query retrieves pairs of lemmas in the CompL-it lexicon from LiITA that have antonym relationships between their senses, including optional definitions of these senses.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>

SELECT ?lemma1 ?lemma2 ?definition1 ?definition2
WHERE {
  # Querying the CompL-it lexicon graph via SERVICE clause from LiITA
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # ?word1 is a lexical entry with a sense ?sense1, per OntoLex-Lemon model
    ?word1 ontolex:sense ?sense1 .
    # The sense ?sense1 has an antonym relation lexinfo:antonym to another sense ?sense2
    ?sense1 lexinfo:antonym ?sense2 .
    # ?word2 is the lexical entry corresponding to antonymous sense ?sense2
    ?word2 ontolex:sense ?sense2 .
    
    # Extract the canonical form (lemma) for each lexical entry, accessing written representation
    ?word1 ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma1 ] .
    ?word2 ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma2 ] .
    
    # Optionally retrieve definitions of the senses using skos:definition property
    OPTIONAL { ?sense1 skos:definition ?definition1 }
    OPTIONAL { ?sense2 skos:definition ?definition2 }
  }
}
LIMIT 50  # Limit results to 50 pairs for manageable output
nl: Which lemmas have antonym relationships in the CompL-it lexicon?

nl_variants.generic: Which lemmas in the CompL-it lexicon are linked by antonym relationships?
nl_variants.linguist: What lemmas in the CompL-it lexical resource have antonymous sense relationships, optionally with their sense definitions?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve lexemes from the CompL-it lexicon graph within LiITA that have antonym relationships between their OntoLex-Lemon senses, including optional skos:definition annotations for those senses.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find pairs of Italian lemmas in the CompL-it lexicon that are connected by antonym relationships between their lexical senses. The query also optionally retrieves the definitions of these senses to better understand their meanings.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank that have multiple distinct Parmigiano translations (synonymous senses) and orders them by the number of such translations.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>  # OntoLex core vocabulary to describe lexical entries, canonical forms, and written representations.
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>  # Lime vocabulary for lexical resource metadata (used here for provenance).
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>  # Lemon's variation and translation relations vocabulary.
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?italianWord (COUNT(DISTINCT ?parmigianoWord) as ?translationCount) 
       (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?parmigianoWord; separator=", ") as ?translations)
WHERE {
  # ?leItalian represents a lexical entry (lemma) in Italian.
  ?leItalian ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .  # Get the canonical form (lemma) associated with the entry.
  ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .  # Get the lemma's written representation (the actual word string).
  
  # ?leParmigiano represents the lexical entry of the translation in Parmigiano dialect.
  ?leItalian vartrans:translatableAs ?leParmigiano .  # The Italian lemma is linked by vartrans:translatableAs to Parmigiano entries (i.e. potential translations).
  ?leParmigiano ontolex:canonicalForm ?parmigianoLemma .  # Get the canonical form of the Parmigiano entry.
  ?parmigianoLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?parmigianoWord .  # Get the written representation of the Parmigiano word.
  
  # This triple pattern ensures the Parmigiano entry comes from the Parmigiano dialect lexical resource in LiITA.
  # The caret (^) denotes reverse property navigation, matching entries for which this lexical resource is the subject of lime:entry.
  ?leParmigiano ^lime:entry <http://liita.it/data/id/LexicalReources/DialettoParmigiano/Lexicon> .
}
GROUP BY ?italianWord
HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?parmigianoWord) > 1)  # Only include Italian lemmas with more than one distinct Parmigiano translation.
ORDER BY DESC(?translationCount)  # Order descending by number of Parmigiano translations.
LIMIT 10  # Limit the results to the top 10 lemmas with the most Parmigiano translations.

sparql:
# This SPARQL query retrieves adverb lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that have written forms ending with the suffix "-mente".

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  # Querying within the named graph of the LiITA Lemma Bank data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Selecting resources typed as Lemma in the LiILA ontology
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Restricting to lemmas with part of speech tag 'adverb' according to LiILA
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:adverb .
    # Retrieving the lexical representation(s) (written forms) of the lemma using OntoLex property
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filtering to include only those written forms ending with the suffix "mente"
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "mente$")
  }
}
# Ordering the results alphabetically by the written representation string
ORDER BY ?wr
# Limiting the output to 100 results to control query size
LIMIT 100

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian noun lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that have a written representation ending with diminutive suffixes (-ino, -etto, -ello), using OntoLex-Lemon and LILA ontology terms.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  # Restrict the query to the LiITA data graph
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Select resources that are lemmas (Lexical entries modeled as Lemma in LILA)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    
    # Filter to only include lemmas whose part-of-speech is noun, using LILA pos tag
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:noun .
    
    # Get the canonical written form (writtenRep) of the lemma; this is part of OntoLex-Lemon
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    
    # Filter the written representation to those ending with diminutive suffixes: "ino", "etto", or "ello"
    # SPARQL regex matches the string form of ?wr against patterns anchored at the string end ($)
    FILTER (regex(str(?wr), "ino$") || regex(str(?wr), "etto$") || regex(str(?wr), "ello$"))
  }
}
# Order the results alphabetically by the written representation
ORDER BY ?wr
# Limit output to the first 100 results to prevent excessive output
LIMIT 100

sparql:
# This query retrieves Sicilian lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank that have multiple distinct written forms (variants), indicating vowel variation or other orthographic variation.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>

PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>

SELECT ?lemma (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?wr; separator=" / ") as ?variants)
WHERE {
  # Select lemmas that are part of the Sicilian dialect lemma bank in LiITA
  ?lemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
  # Retrieve distinct written representations associated directly with the lemma
  ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
}
GROUP BY ?lemma
# Only include lemmas that have more than one unique written form (orthographic variants)
HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?wr) > 1)
ORDER BY ?lemma
LIMIT 50

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr

  # Query triples inside the named graph for the LiITA dataset.
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # ?lemma is a resource of type lila:Lemma (representing a lemma in LiITA, aligned with OntoLex-Lemon).
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    
    # Restrict lemmas to those with part of speech verb using lila:hasPOS predicate.
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:verb .
    
    # Get the written form representation of the lemma: ontolex:writtenRep property returns a lexical form as a string.

nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian verbal lemmas whose canonical form includes the substring 'auto'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all instances of the class lila:Lemma with part of speech lila:verb in the LiITA knowledge base graph, where the ontolex:writtenRep property of the lemma matches the substring 'auto' (case-insensitive).
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query finds all verbs in the LiITA lexical database whose canonical or base form contains the sequence of letters 'auto'. It searches lemmas labeled as verbs and looks at their standard written representation to check for this substring.

sparql:
# This query counts the number of distinct Italian lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank that have an associated Sicilian translation via the vartrans property.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

SELECT (COUNT(DISTINCT ?itaLemma) AS ?countItaWithSicilian)
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {               # Querying explicitly within the LiITA named graph for Italian lexical data.
    ?itaEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?dialEntry .  # Find Italian lexical entries (?itaEntry) that link to dialectal entries (?dialEntry) through vartrans:translatableAs.
    ?dialEntry a ontolex:LexicalEntry .        # Ensure the dialect entry is a lexical entry per OntoLex-Lemon.
    # Note: The query assumes ?itaEntry represents an Italian lemma and ?dialEntry represents the Sicilian translation.
  }
}
