LIMIT 10                                      # Limit the output for performance/testing; typically, count queries don't use LIMIT.
nl: How many lemmas in the Italian Lemma Bank have an associated Sicilian translation (via vartrans)?

nl_variants.generic: How many Italian lemmas in the Lemma Bank have a Sicilian translation linked to them?
nl_variants.linguist: What is the count of distinct Italian lemmas in the LiITA resource that are linked to Sicilian lexical entries as translations via vartrans?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: How many distinct Italian lemmas represented as OntoLex lexical entries in the LiITA named graph have associated Sicilian lexical entries linked through the vartrans:translatableAs property?
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find the total number of unique Italian lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank that have corresponding Sicilian translations connected through the vartrans relationship, indicating lexical variation or translation between Italian and Sicilian.

sparql:
# This query computes the average number of distinct written forms per lemma for each part of speech (PoS) in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?pos (AVG(?formCount) AS ?avgForms)
WHERE {
  # Selecting from the LiITA named graph where linguistic resources are stored as Linked Data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    {
      # Inner sub-select computes the count of distinct written forms (?wr) for each lemma and PoS
      SELECT ?lemma ?pos (COUNT(DISTINCT ?wr) AS ?formCount)
      WHERE {
        # Each ?lemma is a resource of type lila:Lemma representing a lexical entry in LiITA
        ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
               # Has a part of speech classification indicated by lila:hasPOS
               lila:hasPOS ?pos ;
               # Has one or more written representations (forms) indicated by ontolex:writtenRep
               ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
      } GROUP BY ?lemma ?pos
      # Grouping by lemma and PoS to count distinct forms per lemma
    }
  }
  # End of GRAPH clause limits data to LiITA
}
# Outer grouping by part of speech to compute the average number of distinct written forms per lemma per PoS
GROUP BY ?pos
LIMIT 10
# Limit result to 10 PoS classes to restrict output size
nl: Compute, for each PoS, the average number of distinct written forms per lemma.

nl_variants.generic: What is the average number of different written forms that each lemma has for every part of speech?
nl_variants.linguist: Calculate the mean count of distinct orthographic forms per lemma for each grammatical category (part of speech) in the dataset.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the average number of unique ontolex:writtenRep values per lila:Lemma grouped by lila:hasPOS within the LiITA named graph, leveraging the OntoLex-Lemon and LILA vocabularies to analyze lexical variation across parts of speech.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Determine, for each part of speech, how many unique written forms a lemma typically has on average by examining the dataset where lemmas are linked to their parts of speech and their respective written representations. This helps understand variation in form usage across different grammatical categories.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank that do NOT have any Sicilian (or other dialect) translation recorded, using OntoLex-Lemon and vartrans vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # ?lemma is typed as lila:Lemma (a lemma resource in the LiITA lexicon)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # The written representation of the lemma, e.g. the Italian word form
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter to exclude lemmas that have translations via the vartrans:translatableAs property
    FILTER NOT EXISTS {
      # ?entry is a lexical entry which has the current lemma as its canonical form
      ?entry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
      # This entry has a translation relation to some other entry ?dialEntry (potentially Sicilian/dialect form)
      ?entry vartrans:translatableAs ?dialEntry .
          }
  }
}
LIMIT 10
nl: Which Italian lemmas do *not* have a Sicilian (or other dialect) translation in the KB?

nl_variants.generic: Which Italian lemmas in the database do not have any recorded translations into Sicilian or other dialects?
nl_variants.linguist: Identify the Italian lemmas for which no Sicilian or other dialectal translations are attested in the lexical resource.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve Italian lexical entries (lila:Lemma) from the LiITA graph that lack vartrans:translatableAs relations to any Sicilian or dialectal lexical entries, as represented using the OntoLex-Lemon and vartrans vocabularies.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find all Italian lemmas in the lexical database that do not have any linked translations into Sicilian or other dialects recorded. This helps identify which Italian words are missing dialectal equivalents in the resource.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base whose spelled forms (written representations) contain accented Italian characters, using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Select lemmas (?lemma) and their written representations (?wr) within the LiITA data graph
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter to keep only written representations containing accented characters (à, è, é, ì, ò, ó, ù and their uppercase variants)
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "[àèéìòóùÀÈÉÌÒÓÙ]")
  }
}
LIMIT 10
# Limit the results to 10 lemmas for manageable output size
nl: Find all lemmas whose spelled form contains accented characters (à, è, ó, etc.).

nl_variants.generic: List all lemmas whose written forms include accented Italian characters such as à, è, or ó.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian lemmas whose orthographic representations contain diacritical marks like à, è, é, ì, ò, ó, or ù.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base to return lemmas and their written forms that use accented characters, by selecting ontolex:WrittenRepresentations within the <http://liita.it/data> graph that match a regex filtering accented Italian vowels, leveraging the OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary for lexical entries.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find all Italian lemmas in the LiITA lexical resource where their spelled forms include accented letters such as à, è, or ó. It searches the lexicon entries to identify those whose written representations contain these specific accented vowels, highlighting the presence of diacritics in the lemma forms.

sparql:
# This query retrieves nouns from the LiITA Lemma Bank that have more than one distinct written form, indicating multiple inflectional variants such as singular and plural.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

SELECT ?lemma (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?wr; separator=", ") AS ?forms)
# Selecting lemmas and concatenated list of their distinct written forms
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;  
    # ?lemma is a resource of type lila:Lemma, representing a lexical entry in LiITA
           lila:hasPOS lila:noun ;
           # The lemma has part of speech 'noun' as defined in the LiITA ontology
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
           # Each lemma has at least one written form (?wr) using the ontolex:writtenRep property
  }
}
GROUP BY ?lemma
# Group results by lemma to aggregate all written forms per lemma
HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?wr) > 1)
# Filter lemmas to only those that have more than one distinct written form, identifying nouns with multiple forms (e.g., singular/plural)
LIMIT 10
# Limit output to 10 results for brevity
nl: Find nouns that have at least two written forms — likely singular and plural (or variant plurals).

nl_variants.generic: Find Italian nouns that have more than one distinct written form, which typically correspond to singular and plural versions or variant plurals.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian noun lemmas that exhibit multiple distinct orthographic representations, indicating the presence of inflectional variants such as singular and plural forms or plural variants.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base to extract lexical entries of the class lila:Lemma that are typed as nouns (lila:noun) and have multiple distinct ontolex:writtenRep values, representing lemmas with more than one inflectional written form. This involves grouping by lemma and filtering for lemmas with a count of written representations greater than one.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to identify Italian nouns that possess at least two different written forms, reflecting morphological variations such as singular and plural or alternative plural forms. It selects lemmas classified as nouns and checks their recorded written representations to find those with multiple distinct spellings, which helps understand noun inflection patterns.

sparql:
# This query retrieves distinct lemmas and their written representations from the LiITA Lemma Bank that are in the semantic domain of 'color' based on CompL-it definitions containing specific color-related terms, using OntoLex-Lemon structures and a remote SPARQL service.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  # Querying a remote SPARQL endpoint containing the CompL-it portion of LiITA data
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # ?word is an instance of ontolex:Word, representing a lexical word in OntoLex-Lemon model
    ?word a ontolex:Word ;
          # Fetch the canonicalForm of the word, which links to the lemma (ontolex:LexicalEntry)
          ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma ;
          # Link to sense(s) of the word, which are the meanings associated with the lexical entry
          ontolex:sense ?sense .
    # Using SKOS to get the skos:definition string of each sense to check domain-related content
    ?sense skos:definition ?def .
    # Filtering senses whose definitions contain any variant of "colore", "colorato", or "colori" (Italian words related to 'color'), case-insensitive
    FILTER regex(str(?def), "colore|colorato|colori", "i")
    # Extract the written representation of the lemma (the surface form) as a string
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
  }
}
LIMIT 10
nl: Get all lemmas that are in the semantic domain of 'emotion' (according to ELIta), or domain 'color' (via CompL-it definitions containing 'color')

nl_variants.generic: Find all Italian lemmas that belong to the semantic domain of 'emotion' as categorized by ELIta, or that are related to the domain of 'color' based on CompL-it definitions mentioning color terms.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian lexical entries whose semantic domain is classified as 'emotion' according to the ELIta resource, or which have senses defined in CompL-it with definitions containing references to 'color' and related concepts.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve distinct ontolex:LexicalEntry instances from the LiITA knowledge base that are either linked to the semantic domain 'emotion' via ELIta annotation, or that have ontolex:sense entities with skos:definition literals containing Italian color-related terms from the CompL-it lexical graph accessed via a federated SPARQL SERVICE.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query obtains all Italian lemmas that are classified under the semantic domain of 'emotion' according to the ELIta classification system, or that belong to the semantic domain of 'color' based on their sense definitions within the CompL-it dataset, by identifying those definitions that mention color-related words. This helps in exploring lemmas associated with these two important semantic areas.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all emotions in the ELITA dataset along with their related expressions and sentiment polarity annotations using the LiITA ontology and related vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?emotionLabel ?emotion ?expressionLabel ?polarity ?polarityValue
WHERE {

  # Focus the query on the ELITA named graph containing the Italian linguistic linked data
  GRAPH <http://w3id.org/elita> {

        # Select resources that are typed as elita:Emotion, representing emotions in the LiITA Lemma Bank
        ?emotion rdf:type elita:Emotion .

        # Retrieve the human-readable label of the emotion (rdfs:label)
        ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .

        # Link expressions (lexical entries or forms) that have been annotated with the stated emotion
        ?expression elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .

        # Get the label of the expression conveying the emotion
        ?expression rdfs:label ?expressionLabel .

        # Retrieve polarity annotation resources linked to the expression using MARL ontology properties
        ?expression marl:Polarity ?polarity .

        # Retrieve the numerical or categorical sentiment polarity value for that polarity annotation
        ?expression marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .
  }
}
LIMIT 100
nl: List every emotion in the ELITA dataset, the expressions that convey that emotion, and the associated sentiment polarity information. Elenca tutte le emozioni presenti nel grafo ELITA, insieme alle espressioni collegate e ai valori di polarità sentimentale annotati.

nl_variants.generic: List all the emotions in the ELITA dataset along with the expressions that convey each emotion and their corresponding sentiment polarity values.
nl_variants.linguist: Provide all emotions documented in the ELITA linguistic resource, including the lexical expressions associated with each emotion and their annotated sentiment polarity values.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all resources of type elita:Emotion within the ELITA named graph of the LiITA dataset, along with their rdfs:labels, the expressions linked by elita:HasEmotion, and for each expression, obtain the associated sentiment polarity annotations via marl:Polarity and their values via marl:hasPolarityValue, using OntoLex-Lemon and MARL vocabularies in SPARQL.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to list every emotion found in the ELITA dataset, together with the expressions that are linked to convey those emotions, and the sentiment polarity values that have been annotated for these expressions. Essentially, it gathers information on what emotions are represented, which words or phrases express them, and how the sentiment is quantified or categorized.

sparql:
# Retrieves lemmas starting with "amore" from the LiITA knowledge base, their lexical entries, and associated emotions and sentiment polarity annotations.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?l ?emotion ?polarity ?polarityValue
WHERE {

  # Querying the LiITA Lemma Bank named graph for lemmas
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {

        # ?lemma is an instance of a lila:Lemma, representing a lemma in LiITA
        ?lemma a lila:Lemma .

        # Retrieve the written representation of the lemma (ontolex:writtenRep)
        ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .

        # Filter lemmas whose written form starts with "amore"
        FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^amore") .
  }

    # Find lexical entries (?l) that have the lemma as their canonical form
    ?l ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .

    # Retrieve emotion annotations linked to the lexical entry via elita:HasEmotion
    ?l elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .

    # Get the lexical entry label (for display or reference)
    ?l rdfs:label ?expressionLabel .

    # Retrieve sentiment polarity information associated with the lexical entry using MARL ontology
    ?l marl:Polarity ?polarity .

    # Retrieve the polarity value (e.g., positive, negative, neutral) of the sentiment annotation
    ?l marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .
}
nl: Find all lemmas starting with "amore", retrieve the lexical entries that contain them, and list the emotions and sentiment polarity information annotated for those expressions.

nl_variants.generic: List all lemmas that start with the word "amore", find their corresponding lexical entries, and show the emotions and sentiment polarity values associated with those entries.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve lemmas beginning with "amore" along with their lexical entries, including any annotated emotions and sentiment polarity classifications linked to those entries.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA dataset to extract all instances of lila:Lemma whose ontolex:writtenRep begins with "amore", then retrieve their lexical entries (ontolex:LexicalEntry) having those lemmas as canonicalForm, and gather the linked emotion annotations via elita:HasEmotion as well as sentiment polarity annotations defined using marl:Polarity and marl:hasPolarityValue.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query searches for all lemmas in the LiITA lexical resource that start with the prefix "amore". For each lemma, it identifies the lexical entries that use it as a canonical form. Then it gathers any information about emotions and the sentiment polarity (such as positive, negative, or neutral) that are annotated for those lexical entries. This helps us understand the emotional and sentiment context related to words beginning with "amore" in Italian.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Sicilian lemmas from the Sicilian LemmaBank in LiITA whose written form starts with "b" and gets their corresponding Italian translations, outputting both written forms.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr ?wrIT
WHERE {

    # Restrict to lemmas that are part of the Sicilian LemmaBank in LiITA
    ?lemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .

    # Get the Sicilian written representation of the lemma (ontolex:writtenRep on a lexeme)
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .

    # Find the lexeme that has this lemma as its canonical form, connecting lemma to lexeme
    ?le ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .

    # Find Italian lexeme (?leITA) that is linked via vartrans:translatableAs to the Sicilian lexeme (?le)
    ?leITA vartrans:translatableAs ?le ;
         # Retrieve its canonical form (lemma)
         ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma .

    # Get the Italian written representation of the Italian lemma
    ?liitaLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIT .

    # Filter Sicilian written forms to those beginning with 'b' (case-insensitive)
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^b", "i") .
}
LIMIT 20
nl: Return Sicilian lemmas from the Sicilian LemmaBank whose written form begins with b, and retrieve the Italian translation for each of them. Output the Sicilian written form and the corresponding Italian written form.

nl_variants.generic: List Sicilian words from the Sicilian LemmaBank that start with the letter 'b' and provide their Italian translations, showing the Sicilian and Italian forms for each.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Sicilian lemmas from the Sicilian LemmaBank whose orthographic form begins with 'b', along with their corresponding Italian translation lemmas, displaying both the Sicilian and Italian written forms.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA graph to select Sicilian lemmas belonging to the Sicilian LemmaBank, filtered for those with written representations starting with 'b' (case-insensitive). For each Sicilian lemma identified as a canonical form of a lexeme, retrieve the Italian lexeme linked by vartrans:translatableAs relation, and fetch the canonical Italian lemma’s written representation, returning both Sicilian and Italian lexical forms, leveraging OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks up all Sicilian lemmas within the Sicilian LemmaBank dataset whose written form starts with the letter 'b'. For each of these Sicilian lemmas, it finds the corresponding Italian translation by linking their lexemes. The output lists the Sicilian written form alongside its matching Italian written form, providing a bilingual comparison of words beginning with 'b'.

sparql:
# This query retrieves highly positive expressions from the ELITA dataset in the LiITA knowledge base, obtains their emotions, and enriches them with dictionary senses and definitions of the corresponding Italian nouns using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lime:   <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX rdfs:   <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos:   <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dct:    <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX lexinfo:<http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX ontolex:<http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdf:    <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX elita:  <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl:   <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT
  ?expression ?expressionLabel        # The expression URI and its human-readable label
  ?emotionLabel                      # The label of the emotion linked to the expression
  ?polarity ?polarityValue           # Polarity and its numerical value indicating positivity
  ?sense ?definition                 # The lexical sense and its dictionary definition
WHERE {

    GRAPH <http://w3id.org/elita> {   # Querying the ELITA named graph in LiITA KB
    ?expression elita:HasEmotion ?emotion ;           # Expression linked to an emotion resource
                rdfs:label ?expressionLabel ;         # Expression label (Lemma bank - lemma or expression)
                marl:Polarity ?polarity ;             # Polarity property from MARL ontology
                marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue ;# Numeric polarity value indicating sentiment strength
                ontolex:canonicalForm ?cf .           # Link to canonical form (lemma) per OntoLex-Lemon

        ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .            # Get label of the emotion linked

        FILTER(?polarityValue > 0.7)                    # Filter: only highly positive expressions (polarity > 0.7)
  }

    ?cf ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .                     # Get the written representation (lemma string) from canonical form

    SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {  # Federated query to an external Italian dictionary endpoint

        ?word a ontolex:Word ;                        # Select words (OntoLex lexical entries)
          lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos ] ; # Part of speech node with a label (?pos)
          ontolex:sense ?sense ;                      # Link word to lexical sense (definition)
          ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] . # Match word's canonical form lemma to expression lemma

        ?sense skos:definition ?definition .          # Get the skos:definition of the lexical sense

        FILTER(str(?pos) = "noun")                     # Filter only nouns to enrich with dictionary sense
  }
}
LIMIT 50                                                # Limit results to 50 expressions
nl: Find highly positive expressions in ELITA, get their emotion, and enrich them with the dictionary sense and definition of the Italian word corresponding to that expression.

nl_variants.generic: Find highly positive expressions in the ELITA dataset, identify their associated emotions, and provide the dictionary sense and definition of the corresponding Italian noun for each expression.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian expressions from the ELITA dataset that carry a strong positive sentiment, along with their linked emotions, and enrich these with the lexical senses and dictionary definitions of the corresponding Italian nouns.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the ELITA named graph within the LiITA knowledge base for expressions with a polarity value greater than 0.7, retrieving each expression's emotion and linking the expression to its canonical form. Then, federate this query to an external Italian OntoLex-Lemon compliant lexical resource to obtain lexical senses and skos:definitions of matching Italian nouns based on their canonical lemma forms.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to identify expressions from the ELITA dataset that have a strong positive sentiment by filtering for those with a high polarity value. For each of these expressions, it retrieves the associated emotion and then enriches this emotional data by linking the expression to its canonical Italian lemma. It further connects to an external Italian dictionary resource to obtain detailed lexical senses and dictionary definitions for the corresponding Italian nouns, thus providing a richer linguistic and semantic understanding of these positive expressions.

sparql:
# This query retrieves expressions from the LiITA Lemma Bank that convey strong positive emotions, along with their meanings, polarity values, and dictionary senses, highlighting senses whose definitions or labels explicitly mention the same emotion and ranking accordingly.

PREFIX lila:   <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex:<http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime:   <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans:<http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos:   <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms:<http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs:   <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo:<http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf:    <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX elita:  <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl:   <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT
  ?expression
  ?expressionLabel
  ?emotionLabel
  ?polarity
  ?polarityValue
  ?lemma
  ?sense
  ?senseLabel
  ?senseDefinition
  ?sensePOS
  ?senseLexicon
  ( (IF(bound(?senseLabel) && CONTAINS(LCASE(STR(?senseLabel)), LCASE(STR(?emotionLabel))), 1, 0)
    + IF(bound(?senseDefinition) && CONTAINS(LCASE(STR(?senseDefinition)), LCASE(STR(?emotionLabel))), 1, 0)) AS ?score )
    # Calculate a score for ranking: +1 if senseLabel contains emotionLabel (case-insensitive), +1 if senseDefinition contains emotionLabel

WHERE {

    GRAPH <http://w3id.org/elita> {
    # Target the ElITa graph in the LiITA knowledge base where emotion annotations exist for expressions
    ?expression elita:HasEmotion ?emotion ;
                rdfs:label ?expressionLabel ;
                marl:Polarity ?polarity ;
                marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue ;
                ontolex:canonicalForm ?cf .
                # Retrieve expressions with associated emotions, their labels, polarity info, and link to canonicalForm (OntoLex core)

    ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .
    # Get the label (name) of the emotion associated with the expression

        FILTER(?polarityValue > 0.7)
        # Filter for expressions with strong positive polarity (greater than 0.7)
  }

    ?cf ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    # From the canonical form, get the written representation (lemma) of the expression (OntoLex structure)

          SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
          # Query an external lexicon endpoint (Italian dictionary) for detailed lexical information about the lemma
        ?word a ?wType ;
          ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
          # Find lexical entry matching the lemma; ?word represents the lexical entry (OntoLex lexical entry)

        ?word (ontolex:sense|ontolex:evokes) ?sense .
        # Retrieve senses associated with the lexical entry; includes both explicit senses and evoked concepts

        OPTIONAL { ?sense rdfs:label ?senseLabel . }
        # Optionally get the sense label (name)

    OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:definition ?senseDefinition . }
    # Optionally get the sense definition (a textual gloss)

    OPTIONAL { ?sense rdfs:comment ?senseComment . }
    # Optionally get additional comments linked to the sense (not used in select or ranking here)

        OPTIONAL { ?word lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?sensePOS ] . }
        # Optionally get the part of speech of the lexical entry, via lexinfo ontology, by retrieving the label of the pos class

        OPTIONAL { ?word dcterms:isPartOf ?senseLexicon . }
        # Optionally get the lexicon resource the word belongs to (metadata via Dublin Core terms)

  }
  
}
ORDER BY DESC(?score) DESC(?polarityValue)
# Order results by descending combined score (highlighting emotion match in sense label or definition), then by polarity strength

LIMIT 10
# Limit results to top 10 expressions
nl: For each word or expression that conveys a strong positive emotion, show me its meaning: list the emotion it expresses, its polarity value, and all dictionary senses associated with that word — including their definitions, labels, part of speech, and the lexicon they come from. Also highlight the senses whose definitions or labels explicitly mention the same emotion, and rank those higher.

nl_variants.generic: Show me words or expressions that express a strong positive emotion, along with the specific emotion they convey, their positivity score, and all their dictionary meanings—including definitions, labels, parts of speech, and the sources they come from. Also, emphasize those meanings whose descriptions or labels mention the same emotion, and rank those higher.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lexical entries that convey strong positive emotions, providing for each the emotion category, polarity strength, and all related dictionary senses with their definitions, sense labels, part of speech, and lexicon provenance. Additionally, highlight and prioritize those senses whose labels or definitions explicitly reference the associated emotion.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical graph and the ELITa graph to extract lexical entries linked to strong positive emotions (polarity > 0.7) via the elita:HasEmotion and marl:Polarity properties. For each expression, retrieve the emotion label, polarity value, and connect to its canonical form (ontolex:canonicalForm) with the lemma. Federate with the external lexical database graph to obtain all senses (ontolex:sense or ontolex:evokes) related to the lemma, including their rdfs:label, skos:definition, lexinfo:partOfSpeech, and lexicon metadata (dcterms:source). Compute a ranking score based on whether the emotion label appears in the sense label or definition, prioritizing senses with explicit emotion mentions. This query leverages OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies within the LiITA and ELITa Linked Data ecosystem.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find words and expressions in Italian that strongly express positive emotions. For each such word or phrase, it gathers the specific emotion it conveys, the numerical strength of its positive sentiment, and all the dictionary senses associated with it. Each sense’s definition, label, part of speech, and dictionary source are included. The query also identifies which senses explicitly mention the emotion in their labels or definitions, highlighting and ranking.

sparql:
# This query retrieves words (expressions) from the LiITA ELIta lexicon that are associated with the emotion "gioia" (joy), including their emotion labels and polarity information, using OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?emotionLabel ?emotion ?expressionLabel ?polarity ?polarityValue
WHERE {

  GRAPH <http://w3id.org/elita> {
    # Querying within the ELIta lexicon graph of the LiITA dataset

        ?emotion rdf:type elita:Emotion .
        # Find resources typed as Emotion in the elita ontology

        ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .
        # Retrieve the human-readable label of the emotion

    FILTER( regex(str(?emotionLabel), "^gioia$", "i") ).
    # Filter to select only the emotion labeled exactly "gioia" (joy), case-insensitive

        ?expression elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
        # Find expressions (words/lemmas/forms) linked to the specified emotion via HasEmotion property

        ?expression rdfs:label ?expressionLabel .
        # Get the label (string) of the expression, i.e., the word associated with "gioia"

        ?expression marl:Polarity ?polarity .
        # Retrieve polarity annotation of the expression as defined by the MARL ontology
        
        ?expression marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .
        # Retrieve the numerical value associated with the polarity (e.g., positive/negative score)
  }
}
LIMIT 100
# Restrict result set to at most 100 entries to manage output size
nl: Which words are associated with the emotion "gioia" (joy) in the ELIta lexicon?

nl_variants.generic: What words in the ELIta lexicon are linked to the emotion 'gioia' (joy), and what are their associated emotion labels and polarity values?
nl_variants.linguist: Which lexical expressions in the ELIta lexicon are annotated with the emotion 'gioia' (joy), including their emotion labels and polarity information?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all lexical entries from the LiITA ELIta graph that have an ontological type elita:Emotion with the label 'gioia' (joy), along with their rdfs:label, associated emotion via elita:HasEmotion property, and polarity annotations defined by the MARL ontology, including marl:Polarity and marl:hasPolarityValue.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find all words represented in the ELIta lexicon that are linked to the specific emotion 'gioia' (joy). It retrieves the emotion labels, the words associated with this emotion, and also includes polarity information to understand the emotional valence of each word, helping to explore how expressions convey joy within the lexicon.

sparql:
# This query retrieves transitive verbs from the CompL-it lexicon in LiITA that have example sentences containing direct object articles, illustrating OntoLex-Lemon usage for lemmas, senses, and examples.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>  # OntoLex prefix repeated for lexical modeling
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>  # LexInfo ontology for grammatical categories
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>  # RDFS for basic schema resources like rdfs:label

SELECT * 
WHERE {
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {  # Querying CompL-it dataset endpoint of LiITA
    ?word lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos ]  # ?word is a lexical entry with partOfSpeech linked to a concept with label ?pos
    FILTER(str(?pos) = "verb")                      # Keep only entries where part of speech is "verb"
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .  # Get the canonical written form (lemma) of the verb
    ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .                     # Linking to the sense(s) of the verb (OntoLex structure)
    ?sense lexinfo:senseExample ?example .           # Retrieve example sentences illustrating the sense
    
    FILTER (regex(str(?example), "\\s(il|lo|la|i|gli|le)\\s"))  # Filter examples containing Italian direct object articles (definite articles)
  }
}
LIMIT 50  # Limit results to 50 verbs with examples showing direct objects
nl: Claude Which transitive verbs in CompL-it have examples showing direct objects? (check if correct)

nl_variants.generic: Which transitive verbs in the CompL-it lexicon have example sentences that include direct objects?
nl_variants.linguist: Which verbs classified as transitive in the CompL-it dataset provide example usages containing direct object noun phrases with definite articles?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all lexical entries classified as verbs in the CompL-it graph of LiITA, each having OntoLex senses with associated example annotations containing direct object articles, demonstrating proper usage of the OntoLex-Lemon model for lemma, sense, and example data.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find all verbs listed in the CompL-it Italian lexicon that are transitive and have example sentences illustrating their use with direct objects, specifically by checking for the presence of definite articles that mark direct objects in the examples.

sparql:
# Query to find all nouns in the CompL-it dataset of the LiITA Lemma Bank whose definitions start with "strumento"

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>

SELECT *
WHERE {
  # Use the remote endpoint for the CompL-it Lemma Bank in LiITA
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Select lexical entries (?word) that have part of speech property linking to a resource with label ?pos
    ?word lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos ] .
    # Filter to keep only nouns (POS = "noun")
    FILTER(str(?pos) = "noun")
    
    # Get the canonical form of the lexical entry; the written representation (?lemma) is the lemma string
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
    
    # Get the senses associated with the lexical entry
    ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .
    
    # For each sense, get its skos:definition (textual definition)
    ?sense skos:definition ?definition .
    
    # Filter definitions that start with the string "strumento"
    FILTER (strstarts(str(?definition), "strumento"))
  }
}
LIMIT 10
nl: Find all nouns in CompL-it whose definitions start with "strumento" (instrument)?

nl_variants.generic: List all nouns in the CompL-it dataset whose definitions begin with the word "strumento".
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all noun lexical entries from the CompL-it lexicon whose sense definitions start with the term "strumento."
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the CompL-it subset of the LiITA lexicon to extract lexical entries of class lexinfo:noun with ontolex:senses having skos:definitions beginning with the literal "strumento," using a SPARQL SERVICE query to access the remote graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find all nouns in the CompL-it lexical resource whose definitions begin with the word "strumento." This means we want to identify lexical entries classified as nouns whose sense descriptions start with this specific string.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas that appear in the LiITA Italian Lemma Bank and have matching lemmas in the Parmigiano and Sicilian dialect resources within LiITA, using OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT STR(?italianWrittenRep) AS ?word ?sicilianLemma ?parmigianoLemma 
WHERE {
    # Finding Italian lemmas that are part of the LiITA Italian Lemma Bank
    ?italianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    # Getting the written representation (canonical form) of the Italian lemma
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWrittenRep .
    # Linking the Italian lemma as the canonical form of an Italian lexical entry (OntoLex structure)
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
  
    # Looking for Sicilian forms translatable from the Italian lexical entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?sicilianForm .
    # Restricting Sicilian lemmas to those part of the Sicilian Lemma Bank in LiITA
    ?sicilianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    # Getting the written representation of the Sicilian lemma
    ?sicilianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?sicilianWrittenRep .
    # Linking the Sicilian lemma as the canonical form of the Sicilian form
    ?sicilianForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?sicilianLemma .
  
    # Ensuring the Sicilian lemma's written representation matches the Italian lemma's
    FILTER(STR(?sicilianWrittenRep) = STR(?italianWrittenRep))
  
    # For the Parmigiano resource, linking lexical entries with same canonical form as Italian lemma
    ?italianLexicalEntryPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    # Getting forms translatable from the Italian lexical entry in Parmigiano
    ?italianLexicalEntryPar vartrans:translatableAs ?parmigianoForm .
    # Ensuring the Italian lexical entry belongs to the Parmigiano lexicon resource in LiITA
    ?italianLexicalEntryPar ^lime:entry <http://liita.it/data/id/LexicalReources/DialettoParmigiano/Lexicon> .
  
    # Linking Parmigiano form to its canonical lemma
    ?parmigianoForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?parmigianoLemma .
    # Getting the written representation of the Parmigiano lemma
    ?parmigianoLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?parmigianoWrittenRep .
  
    # Ensuring the Parmigiano lemma's written representation matches the Italian lemma's
    FILTER(STR(?parmigianoWrittenRep) = STR(?italianWrittenRep))
}
LIMIT 100
nl: Which lemmas appear in LiITA, Parmigiano, and Sicilian resources?

nl_variants.generic: Which lemmas are found in the Italian LiITA resource as well as in the Parmigiano and Sicilian dialect resources?
nl_variants.linguist: Which lemmas occur simultaneously in the Italian Lemma Bank of LiITA and in its Parmigiano and Sicilian dialect lexical databases?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that are members of the Italian Lemma Bank and have corresponding canonical forms in the Parmigiano and Sicilian lemma resources, linked via OntoLex-Lemon canonical forms and vartrans translatability relations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Identify all lemmas that appear in the Italian Lemma Bank within LiITA and also have matching written representations in both the Parmigiano and Sicilian dialect lemma resources, using the canonical form and translation relationships defined by the OntoLex-Lemon model.

sparql:
# This query retrieves the parts (meronyms) of the Italian lemma "albero" (tree) from the CompL-it GraphDB using LiITA's OntoLex-Lemon model.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wholeWord ?partWord ?definition
WHERE {
  # Use SPARQL SERVICE keyword to query the remote CompL-it endpoint where LiITA lexical data is hosted
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    
            # Find lexical entries with a canonical form whose written representation is bound to ?wholeWord
            ?wholeLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wholeWord ] .
    
    # Restrict to entries with a part of speech having label bound to ?partOfSpeech (used for filtering to nouns)
    ?wholeLexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?partOfSpeech ] .
    
    # Get the sense(s) associated with the whole lexical entry (lemma "albero")
    ?wholeLexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?wholeSense .
    
            # Find part meronyms (?partSense) that are marked as parts of the wholeSense
            # lexinfo:partMeronym links the part sense to the whole sense (meronymy relation)
            ?partSense lexinfo:partMeronym ?wholeSense .
    
        # Link each part sense back to its lexical entry
        ?partLexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?partSense .
    
    # Retrieve the canonical form written representation of the part lexical entry
    ?partLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?partWord ] .
    
        # Filter: restrict wholeWord to the exact lemma "albero", case insensitive
        FILTER(regex(str(?wholeWord), "^albero$", "i")) .
    
        # Filter: only consider senses where the part of speech is "noun"
        FILTER(str(?partOfSpeech) = "noun") 
    
        # Optionally retrieve a definition (skos:definition) for the part sense, if available
        OPTIONAL { ?partSense skos:definition ?definition }
  }
}
# Limit results to 100 to prevent overloading the endpoint
LIMIT 100
nl: Claude What are the parts (meronyms) of "albero" (tree) in CompL-it?

nl_variants.generic: What are the parts that make up the word 'albero' (tree) in the Italian CompL-it lexical database?
nl_variants.linguist: Which meronymic parts are associated with the Italian noun lemma 'albero' according to the CompL-it lexical resource?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the lexical entries representing the parts (meronyms) of the Italian noun lemma 'albero' within the CompL-it dataset in LiITA, by querying the OntoLex-Lemon modeled graph to fetch lexical entries linked via lexinfo:partMeronym relationships to the lemma senses of 'albero'.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query is designed to find the components or parts (meronyms) of the Italian noun 'albero' (meaning tree) in the CompL-it lexical database. It searches the lexical entries associated with 'albero' and retrieves their parts according to the meronymy relations defined in the dataset, optionally including definitions of those parts.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian words from the LiITA Lemma Bank for which "braccio" (arm) is a part, using OntoLex-Lemon structures to link lemmas, senses, and part-whole relations.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>


SELECT ?partWord ?wholeWord ?definition
WHERE {
  # Use a SERVICE clause to query the LiITA KG endpoint remotely
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    
    # Identify the lexical entry (?partLexicalEntry) whose canonical form is the word of interest (?partWord)
    ?partLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?partWord ] .
    
    # Restrict to lexical entries whose part of speech is a noun, identified by the lexinfo POS property and its rdfs:label
    ?partLexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?partOfSpeech ] .
    
    # Link the lexical entry to its sense (?partSense)
    ?partLexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?partSense .
    
    # Use lexinfo:partMeronym property to find the whole sense (?wholeSense) of which the part sense (?partSense) is a component
    ?partSense lexinfo:partMeronym ?wholeSense .
    
    # Find the lexical entry that corresponds to the whole sense
    ?wholeLexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?wholeSense .
    
    # Get the canonical form (lemma) of the whole lexical entry (?wholeWord)
    ?wholeLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wholeWord ] .
    
    # Filter to select only "braccio", ignoring case, as the part word of interest
    FILTER(regex(str(?partWord), "^braccio$", "i")) .
    
    # Ensure that the part of speech is exactly "noun"
    FILTER(str(?partOfSpeech) = "noun") 
    
    # Optionally retrieve the definition (skos:definition) of the whole sense
    OPTIONAL { ?wholeSense skos:definition ?definition }
  }
}
LIMIT 100
nl: Query: What is "braccio" (arm) a part of? Find Italian words that "braccio" is a part of (e.g., "corpo" for body)

nl_variants.generic: Which Italian words include "braccio" (arm) as a part of them? For example, "corpo" (body) is a word that "braccio" is part of.
nl_variants.linguist: Identify Italian noun lemmas for which the sense of "braccio" functions as a meronymic part, such as "corpo" being the holonym containing the part "braccio".
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve Italian lexical entries from the LiITA graph where the ontology class ontolex:LexicalEntry has a canonical form "braccio" and the associated sense is related via the lexinfo:partMeronym property to a holonym sense; then return the corresponding holonym lexical entries along with optional skos:definitions.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find Italian words that contain the word "braccio" (meaning "arm") as a part. This involves looking up nouns where "braccio" is a meronymic component of another word, like "corpo" (meaning "body"), to understand part-whole relationships between Italian lemmas.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all ancestor wholes in the part-whole hierarchy for the Italian lemma "mano" by traversing one or more partMeronym relationships in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?startPart ?endWhole
WHERE {
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Query runs against the LiITA remote SPARQL endpoint for Italian linguistic data
    
    ?startPartEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?startPart ] .
    # Find a lexical entry whose canonical form's written representation matches ?startPart
    
    ?startPartEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos1 ] .
    # Get the part of speech of this lexical entry (using lexinfo vocabulary, e.g. noun)
    
    ?startPartEntry ontolex:sense ?startPartSense .
    # Get the lexical sense(s) associated with this lexical entry
    
    ?startPartSense lexinfo:partMeronym+ ?endWholeSense .
    # Traverse one or more (+) partMeronym relations (part-whole meronymy) from the start part sense to an ancestor whole sense
    
    ?endWholeEntry ontolex:sense ?endWholeSense .
    # Find the lexical entry whose sense is the ancestor whole
    
    ?endWholeEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?endWhole ] .
    # Extract the canonical form's written representation of the whole
    
    ?endWholeEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos2 ] .
    # Get the part of speech of the whole lexical entry
    
    FILTER(regex(str(?startPart), "^mano$", "i")) .
    # Filter start parts to the string "mano" (Italian for "hand"), case-insensitive
    
    FILTER(str(?pos1) = "noun" && str(?pos2) = "noun") 
    # Ensure start and end entries are both nouns to focus on noun meronym relations
  }
}
LIMIT 100
# Limit results to at most 100 pairs to control query output size
nl: Query: Find all ancestors in the part-whole hierarchy (any number of hops). Uses property path (+) to traverse one or more partMeronym relationship

nl_variants.generic: List all entities that are wholes containing the part 'mano' in the Italian language, following the part-whole relationship through one or more intermediate parts.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all noun lexical entries in Italian representing wholes that include the noun 'mano' as a part, by navigating one or more part-meronymic lexical senses within the lexical semantic network.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base to find all OntoLex-Lemon lexical senses linked via one or more lexinfo:partMeronym properties starting from the lexical sense of the canonical noun form 'mano', returning the ancestor wholes and their canonical forms, constrained to noun classes, leveraging property path traversal in SPARQL over the LiITA lemma-centric graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query finds all larger noun concepts in Italian that include 'mano' (the word for 'hand') as a part. It does this by following one or more part-meronym relationships in the lexical database, identifying all the ancestor wholes connected to 'mano' through the linguistic part-whole hierarchy.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all external lexical resources (lexicons) in the LiITA knowledge base where the given word "corpo" appears as a canonical form.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?word ?lexiconName ?lexicon
WHERE {
    # Match any lexical entry that has a canonical form with written representation ?word
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?word ] .
  
    # Find the lexicon that contains this lexical entry, via lime:entry link
    ?lexicon lime:entry ?lexicalEntry .
  
    # Optionally get a human-readable label of the lexicon
    OPTIONAL { ?lexicon rdfs:label ?lexiconName }
  
    # Optionally get an alternative title of the lexicon (metadata)
    OPTIONAL { ?lexicon dcterms:title ?lexiconTitle }
  
    # Filter to match only the specific word "corpo", case insensitive
    FILTER(regex(str(?word), "^corpo$", "i"))
  
    # Bind the lexiconName to the first available label, title, or fallback to URI string
    BIND(COALESCE(?lexiconName, ?lexiconTitle, STR(?lexicon)) AS ?lexiconName)
}
# Order results alphabetically by lexicon name for easier reading
ORDER BY ?lexiconName
nl: Given a word, show in which external lexical resources (e.g. Sicilian-Italian, Parmigiano, CompL-it etc.) it appears.

nl_variants.generic: For the word "corpo," list the external lexical resources such as Sicilian-Italian, Parmigiano, or CompL-it where it is present.
nl_variants.linguist: Identify in which external Italian lexical databases or dialectal lexicons the lemma "corpo" appears as a canonical form.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all lexicons within the LiITA dataset containing lexical entries whose canonical form has the written representation "corpo" (case insensitive), returning their labels or titles, leveraging OntoLex-Lemon classes and properties such as ontolex:LexicalEntry, ontolex:canonicalForm, and lime:Lexicon.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find all external lexical resources in the LiITA knowledge base where the specific word "corpo" is listed as a canonical form. It searches through lexical entries linked to lexicons and returns the names or titles of those lexicons where "corpo" appears, helping users understand which Italian lexical resources include this word.

sparql:
# This query retrieves pairs of Italian lemmas and their Sicilian dialect translations from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?italianWord ?sicilianWord
WHERE {
    # Select Italian lemmas that are part of the main Lemma Bank dataset in LiITA
    ?italianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    # Get the textual representation (written form) of the Italian lemma using OntoLex's writtenRep
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
    
    # Link from the Italian lexical entry to its canonical form (lemma)
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .

    # Find translations from the Italian lexical entry to Sicilian forms using the vartrans vocabulary for lexical translations
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?sicilianForm .

    # Bind the Sicilian canonical form (lemma) from the Sicilian form 
    ?sicilianForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?sicilianLemma .
    # Select Sicilian lemmas that are part of the Sicilian dialect's Lemma Bank subset in LiITA
    ?sicilianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    # Get the textual representation (written form) of the Sicilian lemma
    ?sicilianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?sicilianWord .
}
# Order the results alphabetically by the Italian lemma's written form
ORDER BY ?italianWord
nl: Get all lemma pairs between Italian and a dialect (e.g. Sicilian) — i.e., Italian lemma and its dialect translation.

nl_variants.generic: Find all pairs of Italian lemmas and their corresponding translations in the Sicilian dialect.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve a list of Italian lemmas along with their canonical translations in the Sicilian dialect as recorded in the lemma bank.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Extract all lexical pairs from the LiITA dataset where an Italian lemma (an instance of ontolex:LexicalEntry with a canonical form in the main Lemma Bank) is linked via vartrans:translatableAs to a Sicilian lemma (part of the Sicilian dialect lemma bank subset), retrieving their ontolex:writtenRep forms accordingly.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to obtain all pairs of Italian lemmas and their dialectal equivalents in Sicilian by accessing the LiITA lexical resource. It identifies Italian lemmas within the main lemma bank, then finds their translations in the Sicilian dialect lemma bank using translation relations, finally extracting their written forms to present corresponding word pairs.

sparql:
# Retrieve lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank that have more than one distinct "writtenRep" (orthographic variant) using OntoLex-Lemon properties.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>  # OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary for lexical entries, forms, and written representations
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?variant1 ?variant2
WHERE {
    # Find Lemma entities with at least one written representation (?variant1)
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?variant1 .
  
    # Find the same lemma with another written representation (?variant2)
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?variant2 .
  
    # Filter out pairs where the two variants are the same
    FILTER(?variant1 != ?variant2)
  
    # Enforce ordering to avoid duplicate pairs in swapped order (lexicographical string comparison)
    FILTER(STR(?variant1) < STR(?variant2))
}
# Sort results by the first variant representation for readability
ORDER BY ?variant1
nl: Retrieve lemmas that have more than one "writtenRep" (i.e. multiple orthographic variants / variants in different resources)

nl_variants.generic: Find lemmas that have more than one different written form or spelling variant.
nl_variants.linguist: Identify lemmas in the Italian lexical resource that possess multiple distinct orthographic variants or written representations.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that are linked to multiple distinct ontolex:writtenRep literals, indicating orthographic variants, by querying the Lemon lexical graph for lemmas with more than one different written representation.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for lemmas in the Italian lexical dataset that have more than one different spelling or written form. It identifies those lemmas which are associated with multiple ontolex:writtenRep properties, reflecting different orthographic variants or forms used across resources.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all lexical senses and their definitions for the lemma "corpo" from the CompL-it Lexical Resource in LiITA using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma ?sense ?definition
WHERE {
  # Querying the CompL-it named graph endpoint as a SERVICE for federated queries
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    
        # Find lexical entries with canonical forms whose written representation matches the lemma
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
    
        # Retrieve the senses associated with the lexical entry
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?sense .
    
        # Optionally get the skos:definition of each sense if available
        OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:definition ?definition }
    
        # Filter lemma to exactly match "corpo", case-insensitive match using regex
        FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^corpo$", "i"))
  }
}
# Order results by the URI of the sense
ORDER BY ?sense
# Limit output to 100 results to avoid excessively large responses
LIMIT 100
nl: What are all the senses and definitions of "corpo" in CompL-it? Retrieves all lexical senses with their definitions for a given word

nl_variants.generic: What are all the meanings and definitions of the Italian word "corpo" in the CompL-it lexical resource?
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all lexical senses and their corresponding definitions for the lemma "corpo" from the CompL-it dataset.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: In the LiITA data hub, query the CompL-it named graph to extract all ontolex:LexicalSense instances and their skos:definition literals related to the ontolex:LexicalEntry whose ontolex:canonicalForm's ontolex:writtenRep matches "corpo" (case-insensitive).
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to obtain every lexical sense and its definition for the Italian lemma "corpo" from the CompL-it lexical resource, by searching the word entry and collecting all associated meanings and their explanations.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all senses of the lemma "corpo" from the LiITA Lemma Bank, including definitions, examples, usage notes, part of speech, and sense identifiers, using OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma ?senseNumber ?definition ?example ?usage ?partOfSpeech
WHERE {
  # Access data from the LiITA knowledge base (Linguistic Linked Data) via a remote service
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    
        # Find lexical entries whose canonical form matches a written representation (?lemma)
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
    
        # Optionally retrieve the part of speech of the lexical entry, using LexInfo ontology
        OPTIONAL {
          ?lexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech ?pos .
          ?pos rdfs:label ?partOfSpeech .
        }
    
        # Retrieve all senses associated with the lexical entry (OntoLex property)
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?sense .
    
        # Optionally get the definition of each sense using SKOS
        OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:definition ?definition }
    
        # Optionally get example usage sentences of the sense using SKOS
        OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:example ?example }
    
        # Optionally get usage notes or additional information for the sense via SKOS notes
        OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:note ?usage }
    
        # Optionally get a sense identifier (e.g., sense number) using Dublin Core terms
        OPTIONAL { ?sense dcterms:identifier ?senseNumber }
    
        # Filter to restrict lemma to exactly "corpo", case-insensitive, anchoring to start and end of string
        FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^corpo$", "i"))
  }
}
# Order results by sense number for clarity and sorting of senses
ORDER BY ?senseNumber
nl: Get all senses of "corpo" with definitions, examples, and usage notes. Provide comprehensive information about each sense.

nl_variants.generic: Provide all meanings of the word "corpo" including their definitions, example sentences, and any usage notes, giving complete information about each meaning.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve every sense of the Italian lemma "corpo" along with their respective definitions, illustrative examples, and usage notes, ensuring a thorough descriptive account of each lexical sense.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical graph for the lemma resource with canonical form "corpo" and extract all its OntoLex-Lemon senses, retrieving associated skos:definitions, skos:examples, skos:notes as usage information, lexinfo:partOfSpeech labels, and dcterms:identifier values, thereby obtaining a comprehensive set of sense descriptions for this lexical entry within the linked linguistic data framework.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to collect all the different senses of the Italian word "corpo" from the LiITA lexical database. For each sense, it gathers the definition, example sentences that illustrate how that sense is used, and any additional usage notes. It also extracts information about the part of speech and a sense identifier to organize the information clearly, providing a full picture of the word's meanings.

sparql:
# This query retrieves the number of distinct senses for the lemma "corpo" in the CompL-it lexical resource using the LiITA knowledge base.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma (COUNT(DISTINCT ?sense) AS ?senseCount)
WHERE {
  # Querying an external SPARQL endpoint for the CompL-it knowledge graph containing LiITA lemmas and senses
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    
        # Select lexical entries whose canonical form (main lemma form) has the written representation ?lemma
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
    
        # Retrieve all senses linked to the lexical entry using ontolex:sense property
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?sense .
    
        # Filter lemmas exactly matching "corpo" case-insensitively; this targets the lemma form in LiITA
        FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^corpo$", "i"))
  }
}
# Group the results by lemma to count the distinct senses for "corpo"
GROUP BY ?lemma
nl: How many senses does "corpo" have in CompL-it? Counts the total number of distinct senses for a word

nl_variants.generic: How many different meanings does the word "corpo" have in the CompL-it lexical resource?
nl_variants.linguist: What is the total number of distinct senses associated with the lemma "corpo" in the CompL-it dictionary?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the count of distinct ontolex:sense instances linked to lexical entries whose canonical form has the written representation "corpo" (case-insensitive match) in the CompL-it knowledge graph within the LiITA Linked Open Data framework.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Determine how many unique senses the Italian lemma "corpo" possesses in the CompL-it lexical resource by counting all distinct semantic sense entities linked to its canonical lexical entry representation.

sparql:
# This query retrieves the number of distinct senses (meanings) for specific Italian lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank, illustrating polysemy by counting how many meanings each specified word has using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma (COUNT(DISTINCT ?sense) AS ?senseCount)
WHERE {
  # Use SERVICE to query the LiITA knowledge base endpoint remotely
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    
        # Select lexical entries having a canonical form with a written representation (?lemma) 
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
        # Each lexical entry can have one or more senses (meanings), connect to ?sense
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?sense .
        # Filter lemmas to only consider the specific words: corpo, testa, mano, cuore (case insensitive)
        FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^(corpo|testa|mano|cuore)$", "i"))
  }
}
# Group results by lemma to count senses per word
GROUP BY ?lemma
# Order output descending by count of senses to emphasize polysemy (number of meanings)
ORDER BY DESC(?senseCount)
nl: Compare the number of senses for multiple words. Shows polysemy (multiple meanings) for a set of words

nl_variants.generic: Compare how many different meanings several Italian words have, showing which ones are more polysemous.
nl_variants.linguist: Determine the number of distinct senses associated with specific Italian lemmas (corpo, testa, mano, cuore) to analyze their degree of polysemy in the LiITA lexical resource.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve from the LiITA knowledge base the count of distinct ontolex:sense entities linked to lexical entries with canonical forms matching specific Italian lemmas, illustrating their polysemy by aggregating senses per lemma within an OntoLex-Lemon graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find out how many different meanings each of the selected Italian words (corpo, testa, mano, cuore) has by counting their distinct senses in the LiITA lexical database. It helps to highlight the concept of polysemy by showing the multiplicity of senses for each word.

sparql:
# Retrieve all senses with their definitions and part of speech for a dynamically provided lemma from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>     # OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary for lexical resources
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>       # SKOS vocabulary used here for definitions
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>      # Used for part of speech labels
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#> # Lexinfo used for part of speech classification
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma ?sense ?definition ?partOfSpeech
WHERE {
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {       # Querying the remote LiITA knowledge base SPARQL endpoint
    
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?canonicalForm .  # Get the canonical form of the lexical entry 
    ?canonicalForm ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .                # Get the written form (lemma) string representation
    
        OPTIONAL {
      ?lexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech ?pos .               # Optionally fetch part of speech from Lexinfo ontology
      ?pos rdfs:label ?partOfSpeech .                         # Get the human-readable label of the part of speech
    }
    
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:sense ?sense .                   # Link lexical entry to its sense(s)
    
        OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:definition ?definition }        # Optionally get the definition of each sense (using SKOS)
    
        FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^corpo$", "i"))             # Filter lemma dynamically (here hardcoded to "corpo", case-insensitive)
  }
}
ORDER BY ?partOfSpeech ?sense                                      # Sort results by part of speech and sense
LIMIT 100                                                          # Limit output to 100 results
nl: Get all senses with definitions for a dynamically provided lemma

nl_variants.generic: Find all meanings and their definitions for a given Italian word.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all lexical senses along with their definitions and part of speech for a specified Italian lemma from the lemma bank.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon to obtain all lexical senses with their skos:definitions and lexinfo:partOfSpeech labels for a dynamically specified ontolex:canonicalForm representing a lemma.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query retrieves every sense (meaning) associated with a particular Italian lemma, including their definitions and grammatical categories, by searching the LiITA lexical resource that uses OntoLex-Lemon to represent lexical data.

sparql:
# Retrieves the distribution of emotions associated with ELIta lemmas in the LiITA knowledge base, leveraging OntoLex-Lemon structures and the ELIta extension for emotion annotation.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
