PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

SELECT ?emotionLabel (COUNT(*) as ?count)
WHERE {
  # Select all resources that are Lila Lemma instances within the LiITA lemma bank
  ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
  # Find the ELIta lemma that uses this Lila lemma as its canonical form (links specific lemma entries)
  ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  # Retrieve the emotion associated with the ELIta lemma via the HasEmotion property
  ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
  # Get the human-readable label of the emotion from RDFS label (standard RDF schema property)
  ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel
}
# Group results by emotion label to aggregate counts
GROUP BY ?emotionLabel
# Order results descending by the count to show emotions with the highest frequency first
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
nl: Retrieve the Distribution of Emotions in ELIta

nl_variants.generic: What is the distribution of emotions assigned to the ELIta lemmas in the LiITA lexical resource?
nl_variants.linguist: Provide the frequency distribution of emotions annotated in ELIta lemmas within the LiITA lemma dataset, based on the ELIta emotion annotations linked to canonical Lila lemmas.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the count of ELIta emotion annotations associated with LiITA lemmas by querying for lila:Lemma instances used as canonical forms of elita:ELITALemma entities that have elita:HasEmotion properties, aggregated by rdfs:label of the emotion class, ordered by descending count.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query collects and counts all the different emotions linked to ELIta lemmas in the LiITA knowledge base. It aggregates how often each emotion occurs, using the canonical forms of lemmas and their emotion annotations, to provide a clear distribution of emotion labels and their frequencies.

sparql:
# This query retrieves the average Sentix polarity score for each emotion linked to lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank using ELIta and OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>

SELECT ?emotionLabel (AVG(xsd:float(?polarityValue)) AS ?avgPolarity)
WHERE {
  # Select resources of type lila:Lemma, representing lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank
  ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
  # Link the ELIta lemma representation to its canonical form pointing to the LiITA lemma
  ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  # Obtain emotions associated to the ELIta lemma via elita:HasEmotion predicate
  ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
  # Link Sentix lemma to the same canonical lemma to connect polarity values
  ?sentixLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  # Retrieve the Sentix polarity value (a sentiment score) for the lemma
  ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .
  # Fetch the human-readable label for the emotion resource
  ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .
}
GROUP BY ?emotionLabel   # Group results by emotion label to compute average per emotion
ORDER BY ASC(?avgPolarity)  # Order emotions by ascending average polarity score
nl: Return the Average Sentix Polarity Score for Each Emotion in ELIta

nl_variants.generic: What is the average Sentix polarity score for each emotion associated with Italian lemmas in the ELIta dataset?
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the mean Sentix sentiment polarity values grouped by each emotion category linked to lemmas in the Italian ELIta lexical resource.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Provide the average Sentix polarity score per emotion in the LiITA knowledge graph by querying ELIta lexemes linked via OntoLex-Lemon canonical forms, aggregating polarity values of Sentix annotations using elita:HasEmotion and marl:hasPolarityValue properties.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query calculates the average sentiment polarity score from the Sentix resource for each emotion connected to Italian lemmas in the ELIta lexical dataset. It does so by linking ELIta lemmas to their canonical forms in the LiITA Lemma Bank, identifying their associated emotions, and averaging the polarity values to show the overall sentiment tendency for each emotion.

sparql:
# This query counts lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank with both Joy and Sadness emotions annotated via ELITA and returns their Sentix polarity labels and counts.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT ?polarityLabel (COUNT(*) as ?count)
WHERE {
  # Select all lemmas in LiITA (LILA ontology)
  ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
  
  # Link ELITA lexical entry to its canonical form which is the lemma
  ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  
  # ELITA annotations indicate the lemma has Joy emotion (Gioia)
  ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion elita:Gioia .
  # ELITA annotations also indicate the lemma has Sadness emotion (Tristezza)
  ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion elita:Tristezza .
  
  # Use SENTIX lexical entry linked to the same canonical form (lemma)
  ?sentixLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  
  # SENTIX resource provides polarity annotation related to the lemma
  ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarity ?polarity .
  
  # Get human-readable label of the polarity from RDFS label
  ?polarity rdfs:label ?polarityLabel
}
# Group results by polarity label to count how many lemmas fall into each polarity category
GROUP BY ?polarityLabel
# Order results in descending order by count
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
nl: Determine the polarity of lemmas annotated with contrasting emotions (Joy and Sadness), Count Lemmas with Both Joy and Sadness by Sentix Polarity

nl_variants.generic: Find out how many lemmas in Italian language data are annotated with both joy and sadness emotions, and show their sentiment polarity along with the count for each polarity category.
nl_variants.linguist: Identify lemmas within the Italian lexical resource that are simultaneously annotated with the emotions joy and sadness by ELITA, then retrieve and count the associated Sentix polarity labels for these lemmas.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base for lemmas (lila:Lemma) that are linked via OntoLex canonical forms to ELITA lexical entries annotated simultaneously with elita:Gioia (Joy) and elita:Tristezza (Sadness) emotions, then retrieve their associated Sentix polarity annotations (marl:hasPolarity), obtain the RDFS labels of these polarity classes, and count the number of lemmas for each polarity label, grouped and ordered descending by count.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to identify Italian lemmas in the LiITA Lexical Resource that carry annotations for both the emotions joy and sadness from the ELITA dataset. It then connects these lemmas to their sentiment polarity annotations from Sentix and counts how many lemmas correspond to each polarity category, providing a breakdown of lemmas by their sentiment polarity when these contrasting emotions co-occur.

sparql:
# Retrieve polarity values and labels of lemmas in LiITA that are annotated in ELIta with both Joy and Sadness emotions and have a negative polarity according to Sentix 3.0.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>                     # LiITA ontology prefix for lemmas
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>                                # ELIta ontology prefix for emotion annotations
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>                 # OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary prefix for lexical entries
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>                  # RDFS standard vocabulary for labels
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>              # Sentix 3.0 ontology prefix for polarity annotations

SELECT ?label ?value                                                    # Select lemma labels and polarity values
WHERE {
  ?lemma a lila:Lemma .                                               # Find resources typed as Lemma in LiITA (core lexical unit)
  ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .                         # Link ELIta lexical entry to LiITA lemma as its canonical form
  ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion elita:Gioia .                         # Filter lemmas annotated with Joy (Gioia) emotion in ELIta
  ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion elita:Tristezza .                     # Filter lemmas also annotated with Sadness (Tristezza) emotion in ELIta
  ?sentixLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .                        # Link Sentix lexical entry to same LiITA lemma for polarity info
  ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarity ?polarity .                          # Get the polarity resource associated with the lemma according to Sentix
  ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarityValue ?value .                        # Retrieve the numeric or categorical polarity value (e.g., intensity)
  ?elitaLemma rdfs:label ?label .                                    # Obtain the human-readable label of the lemma from ELIta resource
  ?polarity rdfs:label "Negative"@en .                              # Ensure the polarity is labeled as Negative in English
}
nl: Retrieve the polarity value and label of lemmas that are identified in LiITA, annotated in ELIta with both Joy and Sadness, and are associated with a negative polarity according to Sentix 3.0.

nl_variants.generic: Find the polarity value and label of Italian lemmas that are marked with both joy and sadness emotions and have a negative sentiment according to Sentix 3.0.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the polarity values and labels of lemmas in Italian lexical data that are annotated with both the emotions of joy and sadness in ELIta and exhibit a negative polarity classification based on Sentix 3.0.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base to extract lemmas (instances of lila:Lemma) whose ELIta lexical entries (ontolex:canonicalForm) are annotated with both elita:Gioia and elita:Tristezza emotions, and whose Sentix 3.0 lexical entries indicate a negative polarity via the marl:hasPolarity property linked to a resource labeled "Negative"@en, retrieving the lemma labels (rdfs:label) and associated polarity values (marl:hasPolarityValue).
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to obtain the polarity information and labels of Italian lemmas that are identified within the LiITA resource, which have been annotated in the ELIta emotion lexicon with both joy and sadness emotions. Additionally, it filters for those lemmas that have been assigned a negative polarity label according to the Sentix 3.0 sentiment annotation, allowing us to explore words that carry mixed emotional annotations but are viewed negatively in sentiment.

sparql:
# This query finds Sicilian words expressing joy by linking Italian lemmas annotated with "Gioia" in the ELIta ontology to their Sicilian translations in the LiITA Lemma Bank.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

SELECT ?italianWord ?sicilianWord
WHERE {
    # ?italianLemma is an instance of a Lemma in the LiITA lexicon (using the LILA ontology)
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma .
    
    # The Italian lemma's written representation (orthographic form)
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
    
    # ?elitaLemma (from ELIta lexical resource) links to canonicalForm ?italianLemma (OntoLex canonical form)
    ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    
    # Filtering lemmas that have an emotion annotation "Gioia" (joy) according to ELIta emotion ontology
    ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion elita:Gioia .
    
    # ?italianLexicalEntry is the lexicon entry that has the canonical form ?italianLemma
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    
    # Using vartrans:translatableAs to find the Sicilian translation form related to the Italian lexical entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?sicilianForm .
    
    # The Sicilian form relates to a Sicilian lemma via its canonicalForm property
    ?sicilianForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?sicilianLemma .
    
    # Restricting Sicilian lemma to only those part of the Sicilian dialect lemma bank in LiITA
    ?sicilianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    
    # Getting the written representation of the Sicilian lemma (orthographic form)
    ?sicilianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?sicilianWord .
}
nl: Query: Find Sicilian words that express joy. Links Italian lemmas annotated with joy in ELIta to their Sicilian translations

nl_variants.generic: Find Sicilian words that mean joy by linking them to Italian words annotated with joy.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Sicilian lexical items that correspond to Italian lemmas tagged with the emotion 'joy' in the ELIta annotation, by examining their translations.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical graph to identify Sicilian lemmas, part of the Sicilian lemma bank, which are linked via vartrans:translatableAs relations to Italian lemmas annotated with the elita:Gioia emotion class in ELIta, using OntoLex-Lemon properties for canonical forms and written representations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for Sicilian words that express the emotion of joy by starting from Italian lemmas that are annotated as joyful in the ELIta emotion ontology. It links those Italian lemmas to their Sicilian translation equivalents recorded in the LiITA linguistic resource, returning the written forms of both languages' words.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank with positive sentiment polarity and their corresponding Parmigiano dialect translations, using OntoLex-Lemon and Sentix sentiment annotations.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?italianWord ?parmigianoWord ?polarityValue ?polarityLabel
WHERE {
    # Select Italian lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the canonical written form of the Italian lemma (string representation)
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
    # Restrict to lemmas from the main Italian LemmaBank dataset
    ?italianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    
    # Link Italian lemmas to Sentix sentiment annotations
    # Sentix lemma has as canonical form the Italian lemma 
    ?sentixLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    # Retrieve polarity resource associated with Sentix lemma
    ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarity ?polarity .
    # Retrieve numerical polarity value (e.g., sentiment score)
    ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .
    # Get human-readable label of the polarity (e.g., "Positive", "Negative")
    ?polarity rdfs:label ?polarityLabel .
    
    # Filter polarity labels to only include "Positive"
    FILTER( STR(?polarityLabel) = "Positive")
    
    # From the Italian lemma, get the lexical entry to connect translations via vartrans
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    
    # Find translations of the Italian lexical entry in the Parmigiano dialect form
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?parmigianoForm .
    # Retrieve canonical form of Parmigiano dialect word (lemma)
    ?parmigianoForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?parmigianoLemma .
    # Restrict Parmigiano lemmas to the Parmigiano Dialect LemmaBank dataset in LiITA
    ?parmigianoLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoParmigiano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    # Get the written form of the Parmigiano lemma
    ?parmigianoLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?parmigianoWord .
}
# Order results by descending polarity value to prioritize stronger positive sentiment
ORDER BY DESC(?polarityValue)
# Limit output to top 50 matches
LIMIT 50
nl: Query: Find Parmigiano dialect words with positive polarity  Links Italian lemmas with positive Sentix scores to Parmigiano translations

nl_variants.generic: Find words from the Parmigiano dialect that correspond to Italian words with a positive sentiment.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank with positive sentiment polarity, along with their translations in the Parmigiano dialect.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon and Sentix vocabularies to select Italian lemmas from the main LemmaBank that have a positive polarity sentiment score according to Sentix annotations, and retrieve their corresponding canonical forms in the Parmigiano Dialect LemmaBank via vartrans translations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find Italian words that express positive sentiment, identified through Sentix polarity scores, and then find their equivalent words in the Parmigiano dialect by linking Italian lemmas to their dialectal translations in the LiITA lexicon. The results show positive Italian lemmas matched with Parmigiano dialect forms.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian-Sicilian cognates (words with the same spelling) from the LiITA Lemma Bank that have emotional annotations, utilizing OntoLex-Lemon structures and lexical translation links.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>


SELECT DISTINCT ?word ?emotionLabel
WHERE {
    # ?italianLemma is a Lemma in the LiITA Italian Lemma Bank
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Retrieve the written representation of the Italian lemma (OntoLex property)
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWrittenRep .
    # Ensure the lemma is part of the LiITA Italian Lemma Bank dataset
    ?italianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/lemma/LemmaBank> .
  
    # Find the corresponding 'elita' lemma which has emotional annotations
    ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    # The 'elita' lemma has an emotion property
    ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
    # Get the human-readable label of the emotion (rdfs:label)
    ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .
  
    # From the Italian lexical entry linked to the lemma via canonicalForm
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
  
    # Using the vartrans property, find Sicilian forms translatable from the Italian entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?sicilianForm .
    # Get the canonical form of the Sicilian translation
    ?sicilianForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?sicilianLemma .
    # Confirm the Sicilian lemma is part of the LiITA Sicilian Lemma Bank
    ?sicilianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    # Get the written representation of the Sicilian lemma
    ?sicilianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?sicilianWrittenRep .
  
    # Filter condition to keep only cognates with same string spelling in Italian and Sicilian
    FILTER(STR(?italianWrittenRep) = STR(?sicilianWrittenRep))
  
    # Bind the Italian written form string as ?word for the output
    BIND(STR(?italianWrittenRep) AS ?word)
}
# Order results alphabetically by word and then emotion label
ORDER BY ?word ?emotionLabel
nl: Query: Find Italian-Sicilian cognates (same spelling) with emotional annotations

nl_variants.generic: Find Italian and Sicilian words that are spelled the same and have emotional meanings or labels.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian-Sicilian cognates exhibiting identical orthography and annotated with emotional semantic features.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA dataset to find pairs of Italian and Sicilian lemmas linked by ontolex:canonicalForm and vartrans:translatableAs that share the same written representation and have elita:HasEmotion annotations, extracting their emotion labels as per the OntoLex-Lemon and ELITA extensions.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to identify words in Italian and Sicilian that are cognates with the exact same spelling between the two languages and that are associated with emotional annotations. It achieves this by selecting lemmas from the LiITA dataset where the Italian and Sicilian forms are linked through lexical translation and have corresponding emotional labels attached, allowing users to explore emotional vocabulary shared across these varieties.

sparql:
# This query retrieves dialect translations of Italian lemmas expressing specific negative emotions from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?italianWord ?dialectWord ?dialectName ?emotionLabel
WHERE {
    # Select Italian lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the written representation (form) of the Italian lemma
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
  
    # Link Italian lemma to emotion annotations via the ELITA ontology
    ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
    # Retrieve the emotion label (e.g., "Paura", "Rabbia") 
    ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .
  
    # Filter to only include negative emotions of fear, anger, sadness, disgust
    FILTER(STR(?emotionLabel) IN ("Paura", "Rabbia", "Tristezza", "Disgusto"))
  
    # Access lexical entries corresponding to Italian lemma canonical form
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
  
    # Use vartrans:translatableAs to find dialectal translations of the Italian lexical entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?dialectForm .
    # For each dialect form, get its canonical lemma
    ?dialectForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?dialectLemma .
    # Identify the dialect lemma bank resource the dialect lemma belongs to
    ?dialectLemma dcterms:isPartOf ?dialectLemmaBank .
    # Get the written form of the dialect lemma
    ?dialectLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?dialectWord .
  
    # Filter to only include dialect lemma banks with "Dialetto" in the URI (case-insensitive)
    FILTER(regex(str(?dialectLemmaBank), "Dialetto", "i"))
  
    # Extract dialect name from the URI of the dialect lemma bank using regex string replacement
    BIND(REPLACE(STR(?dialectLemmaBank), "^.*/Dialetto([^/]+)/.*$", "$1") AS ?dialectName)
}
# Order results by emotion label, dialect name, then Italian word for clarity
ORDER BY ?emotionLabel ?dialectName ?italianWord
# Limit output to 100 results
LIMIT 100
nl: Query: Find dialect translations for Italian words expressing negative emotions. Retrieves words associated with fear, anger, sadness, or disgust across dialects

nl_variants.generic: List dialect translations of Italian words that express the negative emotions of fear, anger, sadness, or disgust.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve dialectal equivalents of Italian lemmas associated with the negative emotions of paura, rabbia, tristezza, or disgusto.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base for dialect translations of Italian lemmas classified as instances of lila:Lemma, linked to specific negative emotions (Paura, Rabbia, Tristezza, Disgusto) via the ELITA ontology, by navigating ontolex:canonicalForm and vartrans:translatableAs properties to obtain dialect lexical entries belonging to lemma banks with URIs containing 'Dialetto'.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query retrieves dialect translations of Italian words that denote certain negative emotions—specifically fear, anger, sadness, and disgust. It does so by identifying Italian lemmas annotated with these emotions, then finding their dialect equivalents across different dialect lemma banks, allowing one to explore how these emotions are linguistically expressed in various Italian dialects.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian words and their dialect equivalents from the LiITA Lemma Bank, showing the sentiment polarity labels and values to analyze sentiment preservation across language variants.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>


SELECT DISTINCT ?italianWord ?dialectWord ?dialectName ?polarityLabel ?polarityValue
WHERE {
    # Select lemmas classified as lila:Lemma representing Italian lemmas in LiITA
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the written representation (lemma form) of the Italian lemma (ontolex:writtenRep)
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
    
    # Link to sentiment information via marl:hasPolarity on a lemma that uses the Italian lemma as canonical form
    ?sentixLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    # Retrieve sentiment polarity concept connected to the sentiment lemma
    ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarity ?polarity .
    # Retrieve numerical sentiment polarity value (e.g. positive, negative intensity)
    ?sentixLemma marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .
    # Get the human-readable label for the polarity resource
    ?polarity rdfs:label ?polarityLabel .
    
    # Find lexical entries with the Italian lemma as canonical form
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    # Use vartrans:translatableAs to get related dialect forms (vartrans models translations or variants)
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?dialectForm .
    # Get the canonical form lemma of the dialect word
    ?dialectForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?dialectLemma .
    # Identify the lemma bank that the dialect lemma belongs to
    ?dialectLemma dcterms:isPartOf ?dialectLemmaBank .
    # Obtain the written form of the dialect lemma
    ?dialectLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?dialectWord .
    
    # Filter only dialect lemma banks with “Dialetto” in their IRIs to restrict to dialect resources
    FILTER(regex(str(?dialectLemmaBank), "Dialetto", "i"))
    
    # Extract dialect name from the URI of the dialect lemma bank using regex replacement
    BIND(REPLACE(STR(?dialectLemmaBank), "^.*/Dialetto([^/]+)/.*$", "$1") AS ?dialectName)
}
# Order results by sentiment polarity label descending, then by descending polarity value, then by dialect name
ORDER BY ?polarityLabel DESC(?polarityValue) ?dialectName
LIMIT 100
nl: Query: Show sentiment polarity for Italian words and their dialect equivalents. Useful for understanding if sentiment is preserved across language variants

nl_variants.generic: Show the sentiment polarity of Italian words along with their dialect equivalents to understand whether the sentiment meaning remains consistent across different language variants.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lemmas and their dialectal counterparts along with their associated sentiment polarity labels and values, to examine if and how sentiment is preserved across these linguistic variants.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base for Italian lemmas (lila:Lemma) and their dialect equivalents obtained through vartrans:translatableAs relations, including sentiment polarity information from marl:hasPolarity and marl:hasPolarityValue properties in the OntoLex-Lemon model, to analyze sentiment preservation across dialectal variants within linked lexical graphs.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to display Italian words and their dialect equivalents together with their sentiment polarity labels and values. The purpose is to help analyze if the sentiment expressed by words is maintained across different dialects of Italian, which can be useful for studies in lexical semantics and sentiment analysis across language variants.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Sicilian words expressing the emotion "love" (Amore) by linking Italian lemmas marked with the emotion in the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon lexical structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?italianWord ?sicilianWord
WHERE {
    # ?italianLemma is a Lemma instance from the LiITA Lemma Bank (ontology class lila:Lemma)
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Obtain the written representation (lemma form) of the Italian word
    ?italianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
    
    # Link Italian lemma to an Elita lexical entry that has the emotion "Amore" (love) annotation
    ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion elita:Amore .
    
    # Get the lexical entry corresponding to the Italian lemma to allow translation relations
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    
    # Via vartrans:translatableAs find a Sicilian form equivalent (translation) of the Italian lexical entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?sicilianForm .
    # The Sicilian form has a canonical form lemma
    ?sicilianForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?sicilianLemma .
    # The Sicilian lemma is part of the Sicilian Lemma Bank (identified by a specific URI)
    ?sicilianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> .
    # Get the written representation of the Sicilian lemma (the Sicilian word)
    ?sicilianLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?sicilianWord .
}
# Order results alphabetically by the Italian word form
ORDER BY ?italianWord
# Limit to 50 results to avoid overly large result sets
LIMIT 50
nl: Find Sicilian words expressing love (combination of joy and trust). Love is a dyad emotion in Plutchik's model

nl_variants.generic: Find Sicilian words that express the feeling of love, which combines joy and trust according to Plutchik's model of emotions.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Sicilian lexical items that convey the emotion 'love,' as defined by Plutchik's dyadic model combining joy and trust, linked to Italian lemmas with the same emotional annotation.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base to obtain Sicilian lemmas linked via OntoLex-Lemon lexical entries to Italian lemmas annotated with the emotion class elita:Amore, representing love as a dyad in Plutchik's model, by traversing canonical forms, emotion properties, and vartrans:translatableAs translation relations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find Sicilian words that express the emotion of love, which Plutchik defines as a combination of joy and trust. It does so by identifying Italian lemmas tagged with the emotion 'Amore' in the LiITA lexical database and then finding their equivalent Sicilian translations. The query helps explore how feelings are represented lexically across these closely related languages.

sparql:
# This query counts, for each emotion category, how many distinct dialect words translating Italian lemmas expressing that emotion exist in the LiITA Lemma Bank, revealing emotional vocabulary coverage across dialects.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

SELECT ?emotionLabel ?dialectName (COUNT(DISTINCT ?dialectWord) AS ?wordCount)
WHERE {
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma . 
    # Selects lexical entries classified as Lemmas according to the LiILA ontology, representing headwords in Italian.

    ?elitaLemma ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    # Links the Elita lexical entry to its canonical form (lemma) in the Italian Lemma Bank (LiITA uses ontolex vocabulary).

    ?elitaLemma elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
    # Retrieves the emotion associated with the lemma, using the ELITA emotion annotation property.

    ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .
    # Gets the human-readable label of the emotion (e.g., "joy", "anger").

    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    # Finds Italian lexical entries with the current lemma as their canonical form, representing Italian lexical units.

    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?dialectForm .
    # Uses vartrans:translatableAs relation (from lemon vartrans extension) to find variant forms in dialects translating the Italian lemma.

    ?dialectForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?dialectLemma .
    # Gets the canonical form (lemma) of the dialect variant form.

    ?dialectLemma dcterms:isPartOf ?dialectLemmaBank .
    # Links the dialect lemma to the dialect lemma bank it belongs to (a dataset/source of dialect forms).

    ?dialectLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?dialectWord .
    # Extracts the written representation (surface form) of the dialect lemma.

    FILTER(regex(str(?dialectLemmaBank), "Dialetto", "i"))
    # Filters only those dialect lemma banks whose URI contains "Dialetto" (case-insensitive), thus restricting to Italian dialect resources.

    BIND(REPLACE(STR(?dialectLemmaBank), "^.*/Dialetto([^/]+)/.*$", "$1") AS ?dialectName)
    # Extracts the dialect name from the URI of the dialect lemma bank using a regex capture group for readable labeling.
}
GROUP BY ?emotionLabel ?dialectName
# Groups results by emotion label and dialect name to aggregate counts per emotion-dialect pair.

ORDER BY ?emotionLabel ?dialectName
# Orders the final output alphabetically by emotions and then by dialect names for easier inspection.
nl: Count how many words expressing each emotion have dialect translations. Provides insights into emotional vocabulary coverage across dialects

nl_variants.generic: How many words expressing each emotion have translations in different Italian dialects? This shows how well emotional vocabulary is covered across the dialects.
nl_variants.linguist: Provide the count of distinct dialectal equivalents for Italian lemmas expressing specific emotions, categorized by emotion and dialect, to analyze emotional vocabulary distribution across dialect varieties.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve, from the LiITA lexical graph, aggregate counts of distinct dialect lemmas (dialect lexical entries linked via vartrans:translatableAs) that translate Italian lemmas annotated with elita:HasEmotion properties indicating emotions, grouped by emotion class labels and dialect lemma bank sources, leveraging OntoLex-Lemon and lemon vartrans vocabularies for cross-linguistic lexical variation analysis.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query is designed to count, for each emotion category, how many different dialect words correspond to Italian words expressing that emotion. It helps to understand the representation and coverage of emotional vocabulary across various Italian dialects by examining translations linked to emotional senses in the LiITA lexical database.

sparql:
# This query retrieves nouns from the LiITA Lemma Bank whose sense definitions in the CompL-it lexical resource contain the substring 'colore'.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#> 
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?wr ?def
WHERE {
  # Querying the CompL-it graph within LiITA knowledge base using SERVICE clause
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # ?word is a lexical entry of type ontolex:Word representing a lemma
    ?word a ontolex:Word ;
          # The part of speech is linked using lexinfo:partOfSpeech and filtered to be "noun"
          lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos ] ;
          # Get the canonical form (lemma form)
          ontolex:canonicalForm ?form ;
          # Get the lexical sense(s) associated with this word
          ontolex:sense ?sense .
    # Retrieve the sense definition using SKOS property skos:definition
    ?sense skos:definition ?def .
    # Filter to restrict only to nouns by matching the partOfSpeech label string exactly
    FILTER (str(?pos) = "noun")
    # Filter to keep only definitions containing the substring 'colore' (case-insensitive)
    FILTER regex(str(?def), "colore", "i")
    # Retrieve the written representation (the lemma string) from the canonical form
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?wr
  }
}
# Limit the output to at most 10 results
LIMIT 10
nl: Among all nouns, find those whose sense definition (in CompL-it) contains the substring 'colore'.

nl_variants.generic: Find nouns whose definitions contain the word 'colore'.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian nouns that have at least one lexical sense with a definition in CompL-it including the substring 'colore'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical resource retrieving lexical entries of class ontolex:Word with lexinfo:partOfSpeech labeled 'noun' whose ontolex:sense skos:definition literals contain the substring 'colore' in the CompL-it graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for Italian nouns in the LiITA lexical database that have dictionary definitions containing the term 'colore' within the CompL-it lexical resource, helping users find words related to color in their meanings.

sparql:
# Retrieves all morphological forms (canonical and inflected) of the lemma "amare" from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?formType ?inflectedForm ?grammaticalInfo
WHERE {
    # Select lemma resources typed as lila:Lemma (core entity for lexical items in LiITA)
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the written representation of the lemma (the canonical string form)
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .

    # Filter to only consider the lemma "amare" (case-insensitive match)
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^amare$", "i"))

    # Retrieve the lexical entry that has this lemma as its canonical form
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .

    {
        # Get the canonical form of the lexical entry (the base form)
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
        # From the canonical form, get its written representation (string form)
        ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
        # Bind this form type as "canonical"
        BIND("canonical" AS ?formType)
    }
    UNION
    {
        # Get other forms of the lexical entry (inflected forms like conjugations)
        ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
        # Get their written string representations
        ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
        # Bind this form type as "inflected"
        BIND("inflected" AS ?formType)
    }

    # Optionally get morphological pattern info (grammatical info from lexinfo vocabulary)
    OPTIONAL {
        ?form lexinfo:morphologicalPattern ?grammaticalInfo
    }
}
# Order results by form type and then by the surface form (for organized output)
ORDER BY ?formType ?inflectedForm
nl: What are all the morphological forms of "amare" (to love)?  Retrieves canonical form and all inflected forms (conjugations, declensions)

nl_variants.generic: Show me all the word forms of 'amare', including its base form and all conjugated versions.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the lemma 'amare' along with all its morphological variants, including the canonical form and its conjugations, with any available grammatical pattern information.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: In the LiITA lexical graph, retrieve all entities of type lila:Lemma with a canonical written representation 'amare'. For each associated ontolex:LexicalEntry, extract the canonical form and all ontolex:otherForm instances, retrieving their ontolex:writtenRep and optionally linked lexinfo:morphologicalPattern values, distinguishing between canonical and inflected forms.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find every morphological form of the Italian verb 'amare'. It starts from the lemma 'amare' as the canonical base form, then looks up all related inflected forms such as conjugations, collecting their written forms and any available grammatical information about their patterns.

sparql:
# Retrieves all morphological forms of the lemma "gatto" along with grammatical details (number, gender, case) from the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon and LexInfo vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?inflectedForm ?number ?gender ?case
WHERE {
    # ?lemmaResource is a Lemma entity in LiITA (lila:Lemma), representing a lexeme
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    
    # Get the canonical written representation of the lemma (the base form)
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    
    # Filter for the lemma "gatto" case-insensitively using regex on the string value
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^gatto$", "i"))
  
    # Link lexical entry to the canonical form (lemma resource)
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
  
    {
    # Include the canonical form as one of the forms to retrieve morphological data for
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    }
    UNION
    {
    # Also include any other inflected forms related to the lexical entry
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    }
  
    # Get the written representation of the form (inflected form)
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
  
    OPTIONAL { 
        # Optionally get grammatical number details (singular/plural) annotated using LexInfo
        ?form lexinfo:number ?num .
        ?num rdfs:label ?number 
    }
    OPTIONAL { 
        # Optionally get grammatical gender details from LexInfo (e.g., masculine, feminine)
        ?form lexinfo:gender ?gen .
        ?gen rdfs:label ?gender 
    }
    OPTIONAL { 
        # Optionally get grammatical case information (e.g., nominative, accusative)
        ?form lexinfo:case ?c .
        ?c rdfs:label ?case 
    }
}
# Order results alphabetically by the inflected form string
ORDER BY ?inflectedForm
nl: Query: Get all morphological forms of "gatto" with grammatical details. Shows number (singular/plural), gender, case, etc.

nl_variants.generic: List all forms of the word "gatto" showing their grammatical features such as singular or plural number, gender, and case.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all morphological variants of the Italian lemma "gatto", including their inflected forms along with associated grammatical features like number (singular/plural), gender, and case.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve from the LiITA knowledge base all inflected forms of the lemma resource identified by the ontolex:writtenRep "gatto", including their morphological annotations for lexinfo:number, lexinfo:gender, and lexinfo:case, by querying the lexical entries related to the lemma within the OntoLex-Lemon and LexInfo vocabularies, and returning each form’s canonical or otherForm with detailed grammatical properties.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query collects all the different morphological forms of the Italian word "gatto" available in the LiITA database. It finds both the base form (lemma) and any inflected variants, providing details on their grammatical characteristics such as whether they are singular or plural, their gender (masculine or feminine), and the grammatical case they represent. This helps understand how the word changes form depending on its grammatical role.

sparql:
# This query counts the distinct morphological (inflected) forms of the lemma "fare" in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>

SELECT ?lemma (COUNT(DISTINCT ?inflectedForm) AS ?formCount)
WHERE {
    # Find lemma resources of type lila:Lemma which represent lemmas in LiITA
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the written form (string representation) of the lemma resource
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    
    # Filter to match only the lemma "fare" (case-insensitive)
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^fare$", "i"))
    
    # Link lemma resource to its lexical entries that use it as canonical form
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
    
    {
      # Match the canonical form of the lexical entry (should be the same lemma resource)
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    }
    UNION
    {
      # Also consider other forms (inflected forms) associated with the lexical entry
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    }
    
    # For each form (canonical or other), get its written representation (the inflected form string)
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
}
# Group results by the lemma string to aggregate counts per lemma
GROUP BY ?lemma
nl: How many morphological forms does "fare" have? Counts distinct inflected forms for a lemma

nl_variants.generic: How many different inflected forms does the Italian verb "fare" have?
nl_variants.linguist: What is the total number of distinct morphological forms derived from the lemma "fare" in Italian?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: In the LiITA dataset using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary, how many unique inflected forms are linked to the lemma resource representing "fare", considering both canonical and other lexical forms?
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find the number of distinct morphological (inflected) forms associated with the Italian verb lemma "fare". It counts all unique written forms linked to the lemma, including the canonical form and all inflected variants, to provide the total number of recognized morphological forms in the LiITA lexical resource.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all conjugated forms of the Italian verb "parlare" from the LiITA Lemma Bank, including tense, mood, person, and number information using OntoLex-Lemon and LexInfo vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?conjugatedForm ?tense ?mood ?person ?number
WHERE {
    # ?lemmaResource is a lemma in LiITA representing the base form (lemma) of a word
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    # The written representation (orthographic form) of the lemma (e.g. "parlare")
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    
    # Filter to select only lemmas that exactly match "parlare" (case insensitive)
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^parlare$", "i"))
    
    # ?lexicalEntry is the lexical entry which contains the canonical form (the lemma) and other forms
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
    
    # Restrict lexical entries to those with part of speech verb (to focus on conjugations)
    ?lexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech lexinfo:verb .
    
    {
      # Include canonical form (lemma) as one kind of form
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    }
    UNION
    {
      # Include other forms (conjugated forms) of the lexical entry
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    }
    
    # The written representation of each form (e.g. "parlo", "parli", etc.)
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?conjugatedForm .
    
    # Optionally get linguistic features of the form (tense, mood, person, number) from lexinfo
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:tense ?t .
      ?t rdfs:label ?tense  # label of the tense (e.g. "present")
    }
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:mood ?m .
      ?m rdfs:label ?mood  # label of the mood (e.g. "indicative")
    }
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:person ?p .
      ?p rdfs:label ?person  # grammatical person (e.g. "first")
    }
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:number ?n .
      ?n rdfs:label ?number  # grammatical number (e.g. "singular")
    }
}
# Order results by tense, mood, person, and number to organize conjugations logically
ORDER BY ?tense ?mood ?person ?number
nl: Get all conjugated forms of "parlare" (to speak). Shows tense, mood, person, and number for each form

nl_variants.generic: List all the conjugated forms of the Italian verb "parlare," including information about their tense, mood, person, and number.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all inflected forms of the Italian verb lemma "parlare," specifying for each form its grammatical tense, mood, person, and number features.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Extract all lexical forms linked to the OntoLex-Lemon lemma resource representing "parlare" in the LiITA knowledge base, including canonical and other forms categorized as verbs. For each form, retrieve linguistic feature annotations for tense, mood, person, and number as specified by the LexInfo ontology, and order results by these properties.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find every conjugated form of the Italian verb "parlare." For each form, it shows the tense (like present or past), mood (such as indicative or subjunctive), grammatical person (first, second, or third), and number (singular or plural). This helps users understand all verb forms and their grammatical contexts.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all inflected forms of the lemma "grande" from the LiITA Lemma Bank, along with compact morphological tags concatenated into a single string using OntoLex-Lemon and LexInfo vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?inflectedForm 
       (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?feature; separator="|") AS ?morphTags)
WHERE {
    # ?lemmaResource is an instance of lila:Lemma, representing a lexical lemma in LiITA
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the canonical written representation (lemma form) using OntoLex's writtenRep property
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    
    # Filter for lemma exactly "grande" (case insensitive) - string matching on the lemma  
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^grande$", "i"))
    
    # Retrieve lexical entries that reference the lemmaResource as their canonical form  
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
    
    # Retrieve forms: either the canonical form or other inflected forms of the lexical entry
    {
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    }
    UNION
    {
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    }
    
    # Get the written form of each inflected form using OntoLex's writtenRep
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
    
    OPTIONAL {
        # For each form, check for the presence of different morphological features as properties
        {
          ?form lexinfo:number ?prop .
          # Bind the number feature with prefix "num="
          BIND(CONCAT("num=", STR(?prop)) AS ?feature)
        }
        UNION
        {
          ?form lexinfo:gender ?prop .
          # Bind the gender feature with prefix "gen="
          BIND(CONCAT("gen=", STR(?prop)) AS ?feature)
        }
        UNION
        {
          ?form lexinfo:tense ?prop .
          # Bind the tense feature with prefix "tense="
          BIND(CONCAT("tense=", STR(?prop)) AS ?feature)
        }
        UNION
        {
          ?form lexinfo:mood ?prop .
          # Bind the mood feature with prefix "mood="
          BIND(CONCAT("mood=", STR(?prop)) AS ?feature)
        }
        UNION
        {
          ?form lexinfo:person ?prop .
          # Bind the person feature with prefix "pers="
          BIND(CONCAT("pers=", STR(?prop)) AS ?feature)
        }
    }
}
# Group results by lemma and its inflected form, aggregating morphological features into a single 'morphTags' string, separated by "|"
GROUP BY ?lemma ?inflectedForm
# Order the result by the inflected form string
ORDER BY ?inflectedForm
nl: Get all forms of "grande" with compact morphological tags. Groups grammatical features into a single tag string

nl_variants.generic: List all the different forms of the word 'grande' along with their combined morphological features shown as a single compact tag.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all inflected forms of the Italian lemma 'grande' accompanied by their morphological feature sets encoded as concatenated single-tag strings.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base to find all lexical forms of the OntoLex-Lemon lemma 'grande', aggregating their lexinfo morphological properties (number, gender, tense, mood, person) into composite tags using GROUP_CONCAT to produce a compact representation of each form's morpho-syntactic features.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to obtain every inflected variant of the Italian lemma 'grande' from the LiITA Lemma Bank, presenting for each form a single string that groups together its morphological characteristics such as number and gender. The goal is to provide a clear, compact summary of the word forms and their grammatical information.

sparql:
# This query retrieves forms from the LiITA Lemma Bank that differ significantly from their lemma, helping to identify irregular verbs or nouns, using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>


SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?irregularForm
WHERE {
    # ?lemmaResource is an instance of lila:Lemma from the LiITA Lemma Bank
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    
    # Retrieve the written representation (string form) of the lemma
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
  
    # Filter to focus only on lemmas exactly matching "essere" (case-insensitive)
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^essere$", "i"))
  
    # Find lexical entries that have the given lemma as their canonical form
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
  
    # Retrieve other forms associated with the lexical entry (different from canonical form)
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    
    # Get the written representation of these other forms
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?irregularForm .
  
    # Filter to select only those forms whose first 3 letters do NOT match the lemma's first 3 letters (case-insensitive)
    # This approximates finding forms that differ significantly, potentially irregular
    FILTER(!regex(str(?irregularForm), CONCAT("^", SUBSTR(str(?lemma), 1, 3)), "i"))
}
# Order results by the irregular form string for readability
ORDER BY ?irregularForm
nl: Find forms that differ significantly from the lemma.  Useful for identifying irregular verbs/nouns

nl_variants.generic: Find word forms of the lemma "essere" that differ significantly from the base form, to help identify irregular verbs or nouns.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve morphological variants of the lemma "essere" whose initial segments deviate from the lemma’s, indicating potentially irregular verb or noun forms.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical graph to obtain non-canonical forms related to the lemma "essere" (a lila:Lemma instance) where the written representations of these forms differ in their initial three characters, using OntoLex-Lemon properties such as ontolex:canonicalForm and ontolex:otherForm, facilitating the identification of irregular lexical variants.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for word forms connected to the Italian lemma "essere" that differ notably from the lemma itself—specifically, forms whose first three letters are different from those of the lemma. This helps find irregular verbs or nouns by focusing on forms that do not closely resemble the base word.

sparql:
# This query retrieves written forms in the LiITA Lemma Bank that correspond to multiple lemmas with different parts of speech, identifying potential homographs causing PoS ambiguity.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>

SELECT ?writtenForm (COUNT(DISTINCT ?lemma) AS ?lemmaCount) 
       (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?posLabel; separator=", ") AS ?partsOfSpeech)
WHERE {
    # Select lemmas, which in OntoLex-Lemon represent abstract dictionary entries
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Retrieve the written representation (string form) of the lemma
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?writtenForm .

    # Link lemma to lexical entry via canonicalForm (lemma is the base form)
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .

    # Retrieve the part of speech from LexInfo vocabulary
    ?lexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech ?pos .
    # Get human-readable labels for parts of speech
    ?pos rdfs:label ?posLabel .
    # Filter labels to include only Italian and English language values
    FILTER( LANG(?posLabel) IN ("it", "en") )
}
# Group results by the written form to aggregate over lemmas and parts of speech
GROUP BY ?writtenForm
# Only keep written forms that are linked to more than one distinct part of speech (indicates PoS ambiguity)
HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?pos) > 1)
# Order by descending count of distinct lemmas, then by written form alphabetically
ORDER BY DESC(?lemmaCount) ?writtenForm
# Limit to top 100 results for manageability
LIMIT 100
nl: Find written forms that correspond to multiple lemmas with different parts of speech. These are potential homographs that create PoS ambiguity

nl_variants.generic: Find all written words in Italian that serve as base forms for more than one lemma with different grammatical categories, indicating possible homographs causing part of speech ambiguity.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lemmas associated with identical written forms but differing in their parts of speech, thus identifying cases of homography with polymorphic grammatical functions.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge base for all OntoLex-Lemon Lemma instances linked via their lexical entries to distinct lexinfo:partOfSpeech classes, filtering for those with identical ontolex:writtenRep values that correspond to multiple PoS to detect lexical ambiguity arising from homographs.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query identifies written forms in Italian that correspond to multiple lemmas differing in their parts of speech. Such cases represent potential homographs where a single spelling has different grammatical uses, causing part of speech ambiguity. It helps in understanding lexical items that can function as different word classes depending on context.

sparql:
# This query retrieves homographs in the LiITA Lemma Bank by selecting their written forms that have multiple distinct PoS (parts of speech), showing each corresponding lemma URI and its part of speech label in Italian.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>


SELECT DISTINCT ?writtenForm ?lemma ?partOfSpeech
WHERE {
    # Select entities typed as Lemma in the LiITA ontology
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the canonical written representation (string) of the lemma as per OntoLex-Lemon
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?writtenForm .
    
    # Link lemma to its lexical entry, specifying that ?lemma is the canonical form
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
    
    # Obtain the part of speech associated with the lexical entry using LexInfo vocabulary
    ?lexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech ?pos .
    # Get the rdfs:label of the part of speech for human-readable form (language filtered to Italian)
    ?pos rdfs:label ?partOfSpeech .
    FILTER( LANG(?partOfSpeech ) IN ("it") )
    
    {
    # Inner subquery to identify homographs: written forms with more than one distinct PoS
    SELECT ?wf
    WHERE {
      # Lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank
      ?l a lila:Lemma .
      # Their written representations
      ?l ontolex:writtenRep ?wf .
      # Lexical entries having those lemmas as canonical forms
      ?le ontolex:canonicalForm ?l .
      # Parts of speech for those lexical entries
      ?le lexinfo:partOfSpeech ?p .
    }
    # Group by written form to count distinct PoS
    GROUP BY ?wf
    # Only keep those with multiple (homographic) parts of speech
    HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?p) > 1)
    }
    
    # Filter main query to only include written forms identified as homographs
    FILTER(?writtenForm = ?wf)
}
# Order results by written form and then by part of speech label
ORDER BY ?writtenForm ?partOfSpeech
# Limit output for efficiency and readability
LIMIT 100
nl: Show each homograph with its different lemma interpretations.  Displays the written form, each lemma URI, and corresponding PoS

nl_variants.generic: Show me all Italian words that have the same spelling but different meanings as different lemmas, including their written form, lemma identifier, and part of speech in Italian.
nl_variants.linguist: List all homographs in Italian recorded in the LiITA lemma database, displaying their shared orthographic form along with each distinct lemma URI and the corresponding part of speech label in Italian.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all entities of class lila:Lemma from the LiITA dataset where the canonical written representation (?writtenForm) corresponds to homographs—i.e., lemmas sharing the same written form but linked to distinct lexical entries with different lexinfo:partOfSpeech values. For each, return the lemma URI, its ontolex:writtenRep, and the Italian rdfs:label of the part of speech, leveraging OntoLex-Lemon and LexInfo vocabularies to distinguish homographic lemmas by their lexical categories.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to identify Italian homographs recorded in the LiITA lemma bank. A homograph here is a word spelled the same but associated with multiple lemmas that differ in part of speech. For each homographic written form, the query lists all lemma URIs along with their parts of speech in Italian, helping users see how one spelling can correspond to different grammatical categories or meanings.

SELECT DISTINCT ?gender

}

sparql:
# This query retrieves up to 50 distinct lemma written representations (?wr) from the LiITA Lemma Bank that have a defined sense with a skos:definition.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT
       ?wr                  ?definition   WHERE {

    # ?lemma is a resource of type lila:Lemma (a lemma entity in LiITA lexicon)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;

                  # The lemma's written representation (e.g., the lemma text)
                  ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .

    # ?form is a lexical entry form that links to the canonical lemma ?lemma,
    # using ontolex:canonicalForm property which connects forms with lemmas in OntoLex-Lemon model
    ?form ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .

    # The form is linked to a linguistic sense via ontolex:sense
    ?form ontolex:sense ?sense .

    # The sense has a definition provided via skos:definition property
    ?sense skos:definition ?definition .
}

# Limit the output to 50 distinct lemma/definition pairs
LIMIT 50

nl_variants.generic: Show me all lemmas that have a definition provided.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian lemmas from the lexicon that are associated with at least one sense including a skos:definition.

# This query retrieves and lists distinct verb moods and their labels in alphabetical order from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon and LexInfo vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?mood ?label
WHERE { 
    # ?form is a form node within OntoLex Lemon that has a property indicating verbal mood (from LexInfo)
    ?form lexinfo:verbFormMood ?mood .

    ?mood rdfs:label ?label.
}
# Order results alphabetically by the mood URI (usually aligning with label order)
ORDER BY ?mood
# Limit output to 20 distinct moods to avoid overwhelming result sets

sparql:
# This query counts the number of adjective lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>

PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT (COUNT(?lemma) AS ?count)  # Count the number of distinct ?lemma resources matching the criteria
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {   # Query specifically the LiITA dataset graph
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .          # ?lemma is a resource of type lila:Lemma (a lexical entry in LiITA)
    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lexinfo:adjective . # The lemma's part of speech is adjective according to LexInfo ontology
  } 
}
LIMIT 10  # Limit to 10 results, though here it only returns one count value

sparql:
# This query counts how many nouns (lemmas) in the LiITA Lemma Bank have a written representation longer than 10 characters.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>

PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT (COUNT(?lemma) AS ?count)  # Select the total number of lemmas meeting the condition, labeling result as ?count
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {   # Querying the named graph for the LiITA linguistic data
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;          # ?lemma is of type lila:Lemma, representing a lexical entry in LiITA
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr ; # Get the written representation (string form) of the lemma
           lila:hasPOS lexinfo:noun .  # Restrict to lemmas whose part of speech is noun according to LexInfo ontology
    FILTER (STRLEN(str(?wr)) > 10)  # Filter lemmas whose string length of written representation is greater than 10 characters
  } 
}

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank whose written representation ends with the suffix "-zione".

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>

PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>

SELECT ?wr

    # Finding resources typed as Lemma according to lila ontology
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Getting the canonical written form of the lemma using OntoLex property

# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base whose written representations start with 'in' and end with 'bile', using OntoLex-Lemon model structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr
WHERE { 
  # Querying inside the LiITA dataset graph which contains lexical information
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Match each resource identified as an instance of lila:Lemma (a lexical entry in LiITA)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Get the written representation (lemma form) of the lexical entry using OntoLex writtenRep property
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    
    # Filter lemma strings to those beginning with "in" and ending with "bile" (case-insensitive)
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^in.*bile$", "i")
  } 
}

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA Lemma Bank that have a written representation of 3 or fewer characters, using OntoLex-Lemon model properties.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr (STRLEN(str(?wr)) AS ?len)
WHERE { 
  # Query the named graph holding LiITA linguistic data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Select resources that are Lemma instances (core OntoLex class for lexical entries)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Get their written representation, which is a lexical form (string literal)
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter to include only strings with length less than or equal to 3 characters
    FILTER (STRLEN(str(?wr)) <= 3)
  } 
}
# Order results by length of string, ascending to get very short lemmas first
ORDER BY ?len
# Limit to 30 results to keep output manageable
LIMIT 30
nl: Find very short lemmas with 3 or fewer characters

nl_variants.generic: Find lemmas that are very short, with three or fewer characters.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base whose written representations have a length between 12 and 15 characters.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr (STRLEN(str(?wr)) AS ?len)
# Select the written representation of the lemma (?wr) and compute its string length as ?len
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Querying the LiITA Lemma Bank graph where linguistic data for Italian lemmas is stored
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # ?lemma is an instance of the class lila:Lemma, representing a lemma in the Lemma Bank
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
           # The ontology property ontolex:writtenRep links a lemma to its written form (string)
    FILTER (STRLEN(str(?wr)) >= 12 && STRLEN(str(?wr)) <= 15)
    # Filter lemmas whose written representation length is between 12 and 15 characters inclusive
  } 
}
ORDER BY ?len
# Order the results by string length, ascending
LIMIT 50
# Return at most 50 results to limit output size
