sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that have more than one lexical sense, indicating multiple meanings.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT  ?lemma ?wr COUNT(?sense) AS ?senseCount
# Select distinct lemmas (?lemma), their written representation (?wr), and count the number of senses (?senseCount)
WHERE {
  # Find resources of type lila:Lemma – lemmas in the LiITA Lemma Bank
  ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
		ontolex:writtenRep ?wr . 
		# Retrieve the written representation of the lemma as a lexical form
  # Link the lemma to a canonical form, respecting the OntoLex lemon model where a LexicalEntry (lemma) points to a Form  
  ?form ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  # Link the canonical form to its senses, capturing the lexical meanings connected to this lemma form
  ?form ontolex:sense ?sense .
}
# Group results by lemma and written representation to aggregate senses per lemma
GROUP BY ?lemma ?wr
# Filter lemmas to retain only those having more than one sense, i.e., multiple meanings
HAVING (COUNT(?sense) > 1)
# Order results with lemmas having the greatest number of senses first
ORDER BY DESC(?senseCount)

# Limit output to 50 results to avoid excessive data
LIMIT 50
nl: Find lemmas that have multiple meanings (more than one sense)

nl_variants.generic: List all lemmas that have more than one meaning.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve lemmas that are associated with multiple distinct lexical senses, indicating polysemy.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: From the LiITA knowledge base graph, select instances of the class lila:Lemma whose canonical forms link to more than one ontolex:sense, retrieving their written representation and the count of senses, ordered by descending number of senses.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find lemmas in the LiITA dataset that correspond to a canonical lexical entry having multiple meanings, that is, those lemmas linked to more than one distinct lexical sense, and display them ordered by how many senses they have.

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas from the LiITA knowledge base that have more than 20 distinct inflected forms, counting forms via OntoLex-Lemon representations.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma (COUNT(DISTINCT ?inflectedForm) AS ?formCount)
WHERE {
  # Restrict to the LiITA data graph containing linguistic resources for Italian
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Select resources typed as Lemma in the lila ontology (LiITA-specific lemma class)
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    }
    # Link lemma resource to its written representation (lemma string)
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    
    # Find lexical entries that have this lemmaResource as their canonical form
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
    
    {
      # Either the canonical form of the lexical entry...
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    }
    UNION
    {
      # ...or one of its other forms (inflected or variant forms)
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    }
    
    # Get the written representation of each form as the actual inflected form string
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .

}
# Group results by the lemma string to count forms per lemma
GROUP BY ?lemma
# Keep only lemmas with more than 20 distinct inflected forms
HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?inflectedForm) > 20)
# Order descending by form count for top results
ORDER BY DESC(?formCount)
# Limit output to maximum 20 lemmas
LIMIT 20
nl: Which lemmas have more than 20 different forms?

nl_variants.generic: Which lemmas have more than 20 distinct inflected forms?
nl_variants.linguist: Which Italian lemmas are associated with more than 20 different inflected variants or forms?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all lemma instances of class lila:Lemma in the LiITA graph that link via ontolex:writtenRep to lemma strings, where the count of distinct lexical forms (accessible through ontolex:canonicalForm and ontolex:otherForm) with their ontolex:writtenRep exceeds 20.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find all lemmas in the LiITA linguistic database that have more than 20 different inflected forms. The query identifies lemmas by their written representation and counts distinct inflected forms related to their lexical entries through canonical and other forms, returning only those lemmas with more than 20 such forms.

sparql:
# Retrieves all forms (canonical and other inflected forms) of the lemma 'bello' from the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?inflectedForm
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Identify resources that are axiomatized as Lemma in the LiITA Lemma Bank ontology (lila:Lemma)
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
  }
    # Retrieve the canonical written representation of the lemma (ontoLex:writtenRep)
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    # Filter to match the lemma exactly 'bello', case-insensitive
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^bello$", "i"))
    
    # Find the lexical entry that relates to the lemma resource as its canonical form
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
    
    {
      # Include the canonical form of the lexical entry as a possible form
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    }
    UNION
    {
      # Also include other forms (inflected or variant forms) of the lexical entry
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    }
    
    # Retrieve the written representation of each form (this includes all inflected forms)
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
  
}
# Order the results alphabetically by the inflected form string
ORDER BY ?inflectedForm
nl: Get all forms of the word 'bello' (beautiful)

nl_variants.generic: List all forms of the Italian word 'bello', including its base and any inflected versions.

nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Extract all lexical forms (canonical and inflected) of the lemma identified as "bello" from the LiITA dataset, using OntoLex-Lemon classes such as lila:Lemma, ontolex:writtenRep, ontolex:canonicalForm, and ontolex:otherForm within the named graph <http://liita.it/data>.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all forms of the lemma "gatto" from the LiITA lemma bank, including their number and gender information, using OntoLex-Lemon lexical entries and form annotations.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemma ?inflectedForm ?number ?gender
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Select entities that are lemmas in the LiITA knowledge base
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
  }
  # Get the canonical written representation (lemma) of the lemma resource
  ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
  # Filter to only keep lemmas matching "gatto" (case-insensitive)
  FILTER regex(str(?lemma), "^gatto$", "i")
  # Link the lemma resource to its lexical entry via the canonicalForm property
  ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
  {
    # Retrieve the canonical form of the lexical entry (likely the same as lemmaResource)
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
  }
  UNION
  {
    # Also retrieve other inflected forms of the lexical entry
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
  }
  # Extract the written representation of the form (the inflected word form)
  ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
  # Extract the number feature of the form from lexinfo ontology
  ?form lexinfo:number ?num .
  # Get human-readable label of the number feature (e.g., singular, plural)
  ?num rdfs:label ?number .
  # Extract the gender feature of the form from lexinfo ontology
  ?form lexinfo:gender ?gen .
  # Get human-readable label of the gender feature (e.g., masculine, feminine)
  ?gen rdfs:label ?gender .
}
# Order results alphabetically by the inflected form string
ORDER BY ?inflectedForm
nl: Show all forms of 'gatto' (gatto) with number and gender information

nl_variants.generic: List all the different forms of the word 'gatto', showing their grammatical number and gender.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all morphological variants of the Italian lemma 'gatto', including their associated number and gender features.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all conjugated forms of the Italian lemma 'avere' with their associated tense, mood, person, and number from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?lemmaResource ?lemma ?conjugatedForm ?tense ?mood ?person ?number
WHERE {

    # Select lemma resources that are typed as lila:Lemma (LiITA lemmas)
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    # Retrieve the canonical written form of the lemma (string)
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    # Filter to keep only lemmas matching 'avere' (case-insensitive)
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^avere$", "i"))
    
    # Find the lexical entry referencing this lemma as its canonicalForm
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
    # Restrict to lexical entries that are verbs (using LexInfo partOfSpeech)
    ?lexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech lexinfo:verb .
    
    {
      # Option 1: the form is the canonicalForm of the lexical entry
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    }
    UNION
    {
      # Option 2: the form is one of the other forms (inflected/conjugated forms)
      ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
    }
    
    # For each form, get its written representation (the conjugated form string)
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?conjugatedForm .
    
    # Optionally get the tense of the form, using LexInfo terms and labels
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:tense ?t .
      ?t rdfs:label ?tense 
    }
    # Optionally get the mood (verbFormMood) of the form with its label
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:verbFormMood ?m .
      ?m rdfs:label ?mood 
    }
    # Optionally get the grammatical person of the form (1st, 2nd, 3rd) with label
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:person ?p .
      ?p rdfs:label ?person 
    }
    # Optionally get the grammatical number (singular/plural) with label
    OPTIONAL { 
      ?form lexinfo:number ?n .
      ?n rdfs:label ?number 
    }

}
# Order the results by tense, mood, person, and number for better readability
ORDER BY ?tense ?mood ?person ?number
nl: Show all conjugated forms of 'avere' (to have) with tense and person

nl_variants.generic: Show me all the conjugated forms of the Italian verb 'avere', along with their tense and grammatical person.
nl_variants.linguist: Provide a list of all conjugated forms of the Italian verb lemma 'avere', including their associated tense, mood, person, and number distinctions.

Return the conjugated forms along with their linked properties for tense, verb mood, grammatical person, and number, using standard ontology classes and labels.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to extract all Italian conjugated forms of the verb 'avere' (to have) from a linguistic database. For each form, it provides detailed grammatical information including the tense (such as present or past), mood (like indicative or subjunctive), person (first, second, third), and number (singular or plural), helping to understand the full verbal paradigm.

sparql:
# This query counts the number of distinct inflected forms of the Italian lemma "andare" in the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma (COUNT(DISTINCT ?inflectedForm) AS ?formCount)
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Looking for lemma resources identified as lila:Lemma in the LiITA graph
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
  }
  # Get the canonical written representation (lemma) of the lemma resource
  ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
  # Filter lemmas to exactly match "andare" (case insensitive)
  FILTER regex(str(?lemma), "^andare$", "i")
  # Find the lexical entry which has the canonical form that matches the lemmaResource
  ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
  {
    # Include the canonical form as a form for counting
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
  }
  UNION
  {
    # Include other forms (inflected or derived forms) linked from the lexical entry
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
  }
  # Get the written representation of each form, which are the inflected forms to be counted
  ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?inflectedForm .
}
# Group results by lemma to get count per lemma (here only "andare")
GROUP BY ?lemma

SELECT ?wr

sparql:
# This query retrieves written forms from the LiITA Lemma Bank that correspond to lemmas serving as both noun and verb parts of speech.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?writtenForm 
WHERE {

    # Selecting resources typed as lila:Lemma, representing the lemma objects in the LiITA Lexical Resource
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    
    # Getting the written representation (orthographic form) of the lemma
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?writtenForm .
    
    # Linking lemma to lexical entries that use it as their canonical form (OntoLex structure for lemmas and lexical entries)
    ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
    
    # Retrieve part of speech of lexical entries using lexinfo vocabulary
    ?lexicalEntry lexinfo:partOfSpeech ?pos .
    
    # Get human-readable label for the POS, to filter for Italian language labels later
    ?pos rdfs:label ?posLabel .
    
    # Filter POS labels to be in Italian language ("it"), ensuring language-specific filtering of part of speech labels
    FILTER( LANG(?posLabel) IN ("it") )
    
    # Only keep POS that are either noun or verb (lexinfo standard URIs)
    FILTER(?pos IN (lexinfo:noun, lexinfo:verb))
  
}
# Group by written form to aggregate over POS values per form
GROUP BY ?writtenForm

# Select among those with more than one distinct POS, i.e., forms that appear as both noun and verb
HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?pos) > 1)

# Limit results to a maximum of 50 written forms
LIMIT 50
nl: Find written forms that correspond to both a noun and a verb

nl_variants.generic: Find words that are written the same way and can be used both as a noun and as a verb in Italian.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian lemma forms whose orthographic representation corresponds to lexical entries functioning as both noun and verb parts of speech.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: In the LiITA lexical dataset, obtain all ontolex:WrittenRepresentations associated with lila:Lemma resources that serve as the canonical form for lexical entries typed with lexinfo:partOfSpeech values of both lexinfo:noun and lexinfo:verb, by querying the graph and grouping lemmas with multiple distinct POS annotations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for all Italian words whose written form is linked to lemmas that appear in lexical entries categorized both as nouns and verbs. Essentially, it finds words that function in two grammatical categories, allowing one to study forms that have multiple syntactic roles in Italian.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all synonyms of the Italian lemma 'casa' from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>  # OntoLex defines lexical resource structures like Lemma, Sense, and Forms
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?lemma ?synonym
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {  # Querying the LiITA knowledge base graph
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .  # Select resources typed as Lemma in LiITA
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .  # Get the lexical form (written representation) of the lemma
    FILTER(regex(str(?lemma), "^casa$", "i"))  # Filter to keep only lemmas exactly matching "casa" case-insensitively
    
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:sense ?sense .  # Link lemma to its sense(s), OntoLex way of representing meaning
    ?sense lila:hasSynonym ?synonymSense .  # LiITA extension relation indicating synonym senses
    ?synonymSense lila:lemma ?synonymLemma .  # Get the lemma associated with the synonym sense
    ?synonymLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?synonym .  # Get the written form of the synonym lemma
  }
}
LIMIT 20  # Limit results to 20 synonyms to avoid very large outputs
nl: Find all synonyms of 'casa' (house)

nl_variants.generic: Find all words that are synonyms of the Italian word 'casa'.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all lemma entries that are synonymous with the Italian lemma 'casa', including their corresponding senses.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all synonym lemmas of the Italian lemma 'casa' by querying the LiITA knowledge base graph. The query matches a lila:Lemma resource with an ontolex:writtenRep 'casa' (case-insensitive), follows its ontolex:sense relationship to obtain its sense, and through the lila:hasSynonym property retrieves synonymous senses and their associated lemmas, extracting their ontolex:writtenRep values.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find all synonyms of the Italian word 'casa' by searching in the LiITA lexical database. It first identifies the lemma 'casa' and then looks up all related senses marked as synonyms, returning the alternative words that share the same meaning. The goal is to provide a list of words with the same meaning as 'casa'.

sparql:
# This SPARQL query retrieves the hypernyms of the Italian lemma 'cane' from the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?hypernym
WHERE {
  # Query inside the named graph containing LiITA data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Find resources that are Lemmas in the LiITA lexicon
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    # Retrieve the written representation (orthographic form) of the lemma
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    # Filter to match exactly the lemma 'cane' (case-insensitive)
    FILTER regex(str(?lemma), "^cane$", "i")
  }
  # Find the canonical lexical form associated with the lemma resource
  ?canonicalForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
  # Access the lexical sense(s) linked to the canonical form
  ?canonicalForm ontolex:sense ?sense .
  # From the sense, find hypernyms via lexinfo:hyponym relation (sense of 'cane' is hyponym of ?hypernymSense)
  ?sense lexinfo:hyponym ?hypernymSense .
  # Find canonical form related to the hypernym sense
  ?hypernymCanonicalForm ontolex:sense ?hypernymSense .
  # Get the human-readable label of the hypernym canonical form
  ?hypernymCanonicalForm rdfs:label ?hypernym .
}
LIMIT 20
nl: What are the hypernyms of 'cane' (dog)?

nl_variants.generic: What are the hypernyms of the Italian word 'cane'?
nl_variants.linguist: Which hypernyms are associated with the Italian lemma 'cane' in the lexical resource?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the rdfs:label of the canonical forms linked to the hypernym senses of the lemma 'cane' in the LiITA lexical graph, where hypernym relations are modeled as lexinfo:hyponym statements between OntoLex senses.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find the more general terms (hypernyms) for the Italian lemma 'cane' by looking up its canonical form and lexical sense in the LiITA data, and then finding senses connected through the hyponym property to hypernym senses, returning their readable labels.

sparql:
# This query retrieves irregular forms of the Italian lemma 'essere' from the LiITA Lemma Bank that differ significantly in spelling from the canonical lemma form.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?irregularForm
WHERE {
  # Querying the LiITA data graph, containing linguistic resources encoded using OntoLex-Lemon
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Select resources typed as a Lemma (lila:Lemma) which represent canonical lemma entries in the lexicon
    ?lemmaResource a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the written representation of the lemma (the lexical form as a string)
    ?lemmaResource ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    # Filter to only consider the lemma 'essere' with case-insensitive matching
    FILTER regex(str(?lemma), "^essere$", "i")
  }
  # Link lemma resource as the canonical form of a lexical entry, a higher-level OntoLex structure grouping forms
  ?lexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemmaResource .
  # Get other (non-canonical) forms associated with the lexical entry
  ?lexicalEntry ontolex:otherForm ?form .
  # Extract the written representation of these other forms
  ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?irregularForm .
  # Filter to exclude forms that start similarly to the lemma (using first 3 characters) to find irregular/different forms
  FILTER (!regex(str(?irregularForm), CONCAT("^", substr(str(?lemma), 1, 3)), "i"))
}
# Sort results alphabetically by the irregular form string
ORDER BY ?irregularForm
# Limit results to 20 entries to keep the output manageable
LIMIT 20
nl: Find forms of 'essere' (to be) that are very different from the lemma

nl_variants.generic: Find all forms of the Italian verb 'essere' that look very different from the base form 'essere'.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve irregular morphological variants of the Italian lemma 'essere' whose orthographic forms do not begin with the same three-letter sequence as the lemma.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: In the LiITA knowledge base graph, select all ontolex:otherForm lexical entries linked to the canonical lila:Lemma 'essere' that have ontolex:writtenRep values diverging orthographically from the first three characters of the lemma's written representation, leveraging OntoLex-Lemon modeling of morphological variation.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to identify irregular forms of the Italian verb 'essere' by finding lexical variants that differ significantly in spelling from the canonical lemma form, specifically those whose written forms do not start with the same initial three letters, highlighting forms that are not obvious derivations of the lemma.

sparql:
# This query retrieves the count of lemmas grouped by their part of speech (POS) from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?pos (COUNT(?lemma) AS ?count)
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Select each lemma resource in the LiITA dataset
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Link lemma to its written representation(s)
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr ;
           # Link lemma to its part of speech, using lila:hasPOS property
           lila:hasPOS ?pos .
    # Filter to include only written representations in Italian language ('it')
    FILTER( LANG(?wr) IN ("it") )
  } 
}
# Group results by the part of speech to aggregate counts per POS
GROUP BY ?pos
# Order results descending by the number of lemmas per POS
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
# Limit output to top 20 POS based on lemma count
LIMIT 20
nl: Show the distribution of lemmas by part of speech (count for each POS)

nl_variants.generic: Show how many lemmas there are for each part of speech in Italian.
nl_variants.linguist: Provide the frequency distribution of Italian lemmas categorized by their grammatical part of speech.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve counts of Italian lemmas grouped by their part of speech (POS) from the LiITA dataset, which models lexical entries using the OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary. The query aggregates lemma instances linked to their POS classes via the lila:hasPOS property within the LiITA graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query is designed to find out how many Italian lemmas exist for each part of speech by counting the lemmas and grouping them by their POS category. It helps understand the distribution of lexical entries across different grammatical classes in the LiITA lexical resource.

sparql:
# This query calculates the average length of Italian words grouped by their part of speech (POS) in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?pos (AVG(STRLEN(str(?wr))) AS ?avgLength)
WHERE { 
  # Query the LiITA data named graph containing Italian lemmas
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Select lexical entries typed as lila:Lemma (lemma-level in OntoLex-Lemon)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
           # Get the canonical written form of the lemma
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr ;
           # Retrieve the part of speech (POS) associated with the lemma in LiITA
           lila:hasPOS ?pos .
    # Filter for Italian words by ensuring written form language tag is "it"
    FILTER( LANG(?wr) IN ("it") )
  } 
}
# Group results by POS to compute one average word length per POS category
GROUP BY ?pos
# Order the results by average length descending (longest words first)
ORDER BY DESC(?avgLength)
# Limit results to top 20 POS categories for readability
LIMIT 20
nl: What is the average length of words for each part of speech?

nl_variants.generic: What is the average number of characters in Italian words for each part of speech?
nl_variants.linguist: Could you provide the average length, in characters, of Italian lemmas grouped by their morphosyntactic categories (parts of speech)?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the average string length of canonical forms of Italian lexical entries (ontolex:Lemma) grouped by their part of speech (lila:hasPOS) from the LiITA named graph, using OntoLex-Lemon vocabulary and lexinfo POS annotations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query determines, for Italian words, the average length measured as the number of characters in their canonical forms, separately calculated for each part of speech category. It helps to understand how word length varies according to grammatical class in the LiITA lemma collection.

sparql:
# This query retrieves verbs in the LiITA Lemma Bank whose written forms start with 'ri-' and are longer than 8 characters, ordered by length descending.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr (STRLEN(str(?wr)) AS ?len) 
# Select the written representation of the lemma (?wr)
# and also compute the length of this string (?len) for ordering/filtering
WHERE { 
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> { 
    # Query the LiITA named graph containing Italian lexical data
    
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma ;
    # ?lemma is a resource of type lila:Lemma (a lemma entry in LiITA)
    
           ontolex:writtenRep ?wr ;
           # The written form of the lemma is bound to ?wr (a literal string)
           
           lila:hasPOS lila:verb .
           # Restrict lemmas to those with the part-of-speech property indicating verbs
    
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^ri")
    # Apply regex filter to keep only lemmas whose written form starts with "ri"
    
    FILTER (STRLEN(str(?wr)) > 8)
    # Apply filter to keep only lemmas with written form length greater than 8 characters
  } 
}
ORDER BY DESC(?len)
# Order results by string length descending, showing longer verbs first
LIMIT 40
# Limit output to top 40 results
nl: Find verbs starting with 'ri-' that are longer than 8 characters

nl_variants.generic: Find Italian verbs that begin with 'ri-' and have more than eight letters.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all Italian verb lemmas whose written forms start with the prefix 'ri' and are longer than eight characters.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical data graph for OntoLex-Lemon Lemma instances typed as verbs, retrieving their written representations that match the regex '^ri' and whose string length exceeds eight characters, ordered by descending length, limiting to the top 40 results.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Identify Italian verbs from the LiITA lexical resource that start with the letters 'ri' and contain more than eight characters in their written form. This query lists these verbs by length, showing the longest ones first, and provides up to 40 examples.

sparql:
# This query retrieves hyponyms (more specific types) of the lemma "animale" from the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?hyponymWord
WHERE {
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Find a lexical entry ?word with a canonical form having the written representation "animale"
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] .
    # Filtering the written representation to be exactly the string "animale"
    FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "animale" ) .
    
    # Get the sense(s) of the lexical entry ?word
    ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .
    # Using lexinfo:hypernym relationship, find hyponym senses ?hypoSense that are more specific than ?sense
    ?sense lexinfo:hypernym ?hypoSense .
    
    # Find lexical entries ?hypoWord associated with these hyponym senses
    ?hypoWord ontolex:sense ?hypoSense ;
              # Get their canonical form's written representation as the hyponym word strings
              ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?hyponymWord ] .
  }
}
LIMIT 20
nl: Find hyponyms of 'animale' (animal) - more specific types

nl_variants.generic: List specific subtypes or examples that are kinds of the word 'animal'.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all lexical entries that denote hyponyms of the lemma 'animale', i.e., words semantically more specific than 'animal'.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: From the LiITA knowledge base, query lexical entries with canonical form 'animale' and obtain their senses; then, via lexinfo:hypernym relations on these senses, extract the hyponym senses and the corresponding lexical entries, retrieving the canonical forms of these more specific terms in the OntoLex-Lemon data graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query aims to find words that are more specific types or subcategories of the term 'animale' (animal). By looking at the lexical entry for 'animale' and examining hyponym relationships, it identifies lemmas that represent kinds of animals, thus providing a list of more precise or narrower terms under the general concept of 'animal'.

sparql:
# This query retrieves broader category terms (hypernyms) of the Italian word "cane" from the LiITA knowledge base using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?hypernymWord
WHERE {
  # Use the remote LiITA endpoint with SERVICE clause for federated query
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Match a lexical entry with a canonical form that has a written representation ?wrIta
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] .
    # Filter to keep only the lexical entry whose canonical form is the string "cane"
    FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "cane" ) .
    
    # Get the lexical sense(s) associated with the lexical entry "cane"
    ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .
    # From this sense, follow lexinfo:hyponym property to find the broader sense ?hyperSense
    # Note: lexinfo:hyponym here points from a sense to a more general sense (hypernym)
    ?sense lexinfo:hyponym ?hyperSense .
    
    # Retrieve the lexical entry associated with the hypernym sense ?hyperSense
    # and its canonical form's written representation ?hypernymWord
    ?hyperWord ontolex:sense ?hyperSense ;
               ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?hypernymWord ] .
  }
}
LIMIT 20
nl: What is 'cane' (dog) a type of? Find broader categories

sparql:
# This query retrieves antonyms of the Italian adjective 'caldo' from the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon lexical structures and vartrans relations.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?antonymWord
WHERE {
  # Use federated query SERVICE to access the LiITA knowledge base endpoint
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Find words with a canonical form having the written representation ?wrIta
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] .
    # Filter to select only the lemma 'caldo' as exact string match
    FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "caldo" ) .
    
    # Get the lexical sense(s) associated with the word
    ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .
    # Use the lexinfo:antonym property to find related antonym senses
    ?sense lexinfo:antonym ?antonymSense .
    
    # From the antonym sense, retrieve the lexical entry and its canonical form writtenRep
    ?antonymWordEntry ontolex:sense ?antonymSense ;
                      ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?antonymWord ] .
  }
}
LIMIT 20

sparql:
# This query retrieves the definition(s) of the Italian lemma "amore" from the LiITA Lemma Bank, using OntoLex-Lemon structures to access canonical forms and senses.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>

PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?definition
WHERE {
  # Querying the remote LiITA knowledge base service containing lemma data for Italian
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Find a lexical entry (?word) with a canonical form whose written representation is bound to ?wrIta
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] .
    # Filter so that only the lexical entry whose canonical form's written representation exactly matches "amore" is selected
    FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "amore" ) .
    
    # From the selected lexical entry, access its sense(s), which are skos:Concepts or similar, and get their skos:definition(s)
    ?word ontolex:sense [ skos:definition ?definition ] .
  }
}
LIMIT 10

sparql:
# This query retrieves lemmas and their definitions from the LiITA Lemma Bank in which the definition contains the word "posto" (place).

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?wr ?definition
WHERE {
  # Querying a remote SPARQL endpoint hosting the LiITA ontology data
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # ?word is a lexical entry with at least one sense with a definition and a canonical written form
    ?word ontolex:sense [ skos:definition ?definition ] ;  # Access the sense blank node and its definition using the SKOS vocabulary
          ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wr ] . # Access the canonical form's written representation (lemma)

    # Filter to include only definitions containing the term "posto" (case insensitive)
    FILTER regex(?definition, "posto", "i")
  }
}
LIMIT 30  # Limit to 30 results to avoid excessive output

nl_variants.generic: Find Italian words whose definitions include the term 'posto' (place).
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve lemmas from the Italian lexicon whose semantic definitions contain the word 'posto'.

nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for Italian words in the LiITA Lemma Bank whose definitions mention the word 'posto', meaning 'place', by searching all definitions and listing those lemmas whose explanatory text includes that specific term.

sparql:
# This query counts how many senses the Italian lemma "banco" has in the LiITA Lemma Bank using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>

PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT (COUNT(?sense) AS ?senseCount)  # Select the total number of senses linked to the lemma "banco"
WHERE {
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {  # Query the remote LiITA GraphDB SPARQL endpoint
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] .  # Match words with canonicalForm having a writtenRep in Italian
    FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "banco" ) .  # Filter the written representations to the string "banco"
    
    ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .  # Retrieve all senses associated with the matched lemma (word)
  }
}

sparql:
# This query retrieves all senses of the Italian lemma 'piano' from the LiITA knowledge base, including their definitions, examples, and labels using OntoLex-Lemon structures.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

SELECT ?sense ?definition ?example ?label
WHERE {
  # Querying the LiITA SPARQL endpoint for Italian lexical data
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Retrieve lexical entry (?word) with canonical form having written representation (?wrIta)
    ?word ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIta ] .
    # Filter to match only entries where the written form equals "piano"
    FILTER ( STR(?wrIta) = "piano" ) .
    
    # Get all senses associated with the lexical entry ?word
    ?word ontolex:sense ?sense .
    
    # Optionally get the sense's definition, linked via skos:definition
    OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:definition ?definition }
    # Optionally get example sentences or usage instances for the sense, via skos:example
    OPTIONAL { ?sense skos:example ?example }
    # Optionally get human-readable label for the sense, via rdfs:label
    OPTIONAL { ?sense rdfs:label ?label }
  }
}
LIMIT 20  # Limit results to 20 senses to avoid too large output
nl: Get all senses of 'piano' with definitions and examples

nl_variants.generic: Retrieve all meanings of the word 'piano' in Italian, including their definitions and example sentences.
nl_variants.linguist: List all senses associated with the Italian lemma 'piano', providing each sense's definition, illustrative examples, and labels where available.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA lexical Linked Data graph to extract all OntoLex-Lemon sense instances linked to the lexical entry for 'piano', including optional skos:definitions, skos:examples, and rdfs:labels, limiting to 20 results.
nl_variants.pedagogical: Find all different senses of the Italian word 'piano' as recorded in the LiITA lexical dataset, retrieving for each sense any available definitions, example uses, and descriptive labels, to better understand the various meanings and contexts of the word.

sparql:
# This query retrieves distinct words (?wr) from the LiITA Lemma Bank associated with the emotion 'paura' (fear) using OntoLex-Lemon and related vocabularies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT  ?wr 
WHERE {
  # Restricting to the LiITA data graph where the lemma data is stored
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
        # ?lemma is typed as lila:Lemma, representing a lemma in the LiITA dataset
        ?lemma a lila:Lemma .

        # Extract the written representation (orthographic form) of the lemma as ?wr
        ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
  }
    # ?l is a lexical entry (ontoLex:LexicalEntry) that has the canonical form ?lemma
    ?l ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
    # Linking the lexical entry ?l to an emotion using a property from the ELITA vocabulary
    ?l elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
    # Label of the lexical entry, typically the surface form or expression
    ?l rdfs:label ?expressionLabel .
    # The emotion resource ?emotion has a label which will be matched against the target emotion 'paura'
    ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .

   # Filter to keep only those emotion labels containing "paura" (case insensitive)
   FILTER regex(str(?emotionLabel), "paura", "i") .
  
} 
LIMIT 100
nl: Which words are associated with the emotion 'paura' (fear)?

nl_variants.generic: Which words are connected to the emotion of fear, specifically the feeling referred to as 'paura'?
nl_variants.linguist: Which Italian lexical items in the LiITA dataset are semantically linked to the emotion labeled 'paura' (fear)?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve distinct lexical forms from the LiITA dataset where lemmas linked via ontolex:canonicalForm to lexical entries are associated through the property elita:HasEmotion to an emotion resource with a label matching 'paura', using the OntoLex-Lemon model and relevant vocabulary terms within the LiITA named graph.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query looks for words in the LiITA lexical database that are associated with the emotion 'paura', meaning fear. It finds lemmas whose lexical entries indicate a connection to this emotion, helping us understand which words in Italian evoke or relate to fear.

sparql:
# This query retrieves all emotions from the LiITA Lemma Bank and counts how many lexical entries (words) express each emotion using OntoLex-Lemon and elita vocabulary.
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT   ?emotionLabel COUNT(?entry) AS ?entries
WHERE {
  # ?entry is a lexical entry in LiITA that has a link to an emotion using the elita:HasEmotion property
  ?entry elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .
  # ?emotion has a human-readable label, obtained via rdfs:label
  ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .  
} 
# Group results by the emotion and its label to count entries per emotion
GROUP BY ?emotion ?emotionLabel 
# Order the result descending by the number of entries per emotion
ORDER BY DESC(?entries)
# Limit the result to top 100 emotions with most entries
LIMIT 100
nl: List all emotions and count how many words express each

nl_variants.generic: Show a list of all emotions and the number of words that correspond to each emotion.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve all emotions in the Italian lexical database along with a count of lexical entries associated with each emotion.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA knowledge graph to select all emotion concepts connected to lexical entries via the 'elita:HasEmotion' property, retrieving the rdfs:label for each emotion and counting the number of lexical entries linked to each emotion, ordered by descending number of entries.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query retrieves each emotion present in the LiITA database and counts how many lexical entries or words express that emotion. It lists these emotions alongside their frequencies to understand which emotions are most commonly represented in the vocabulary.

sparql:
# This query retrieves highly positive expressions (polarity > 0.7) from the LiITA knowledge base, focusing on expressions linked to emotions with polarity annotations using the MARL vocabulary.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?emotionLabel ?emotion ?expressionLabel ?polarity ?polarityValue
WHERE {

  # Query inside the ELITA graph representing LiITA linguistic resources
  GRAPH <http://w3id.org/elita> {

        # Select all resources typed as Emotion in the ELITA emotion ontology
        ?emotion rdf:type elita:Emotion .

        # Retrieve the human-readable label of the emotion
        ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .

        # Get expressions (likely lexical entries or forms) associated with the emotion
        ?expression elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .

        # Retrieve the label of the expression (its surface form or lemma name)
        ?expression rdfs:label ?expressionLabel .

        # Fetch the polarity property from the MARL ontology describing the expression's sentiment polarity
        ?expression marl:Polarity ?polarity .

        # Fetch numerical polarity value indicating strength of sentiment
        ?expression marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .

        # Filter results to only include expressions with polarityValue > 0.7 for highly positive expressions
        FILTER(?polarityValue > 0.7)
  }
}
LIMIT 100
nl: Find highly positive expressions (polarity > 0.7)

nl_variants.generic: Find expressions in Italian that are strongly positive, with a positivity score greater than 0.7.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian lexical expressions that are annotated with emotions and have a polarity value indicating a strong positive sentiment, specifically above 0.7.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the LiITA graph to obtain Italian expressions linked to emotions using the ELITA emotion ontology, filtering those expressions annotated with MARL polarity properties where the polarity value exceeds 0.7, indicating high positive sentiment.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query searches the LiITA linguistic data for Italian expressions that are emotionally charged and have been assigned a sentiment polarity score. It specifically retrieves those expressions which show a strong positive sentiment, meaning their polarity score is greater than 0.7, to help understand highly positive emotional language.

sparql:
# This query retrieves the average sentiment polarity value for each distinct emotion label from the LiITA knowledge base, leveraging emotion annotations and polarity values within the elita and marl ontologies.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT ?emotionLabel AVG(?polarityValue) AS ?avgPolarityValue
WHERE {

  # Query is scoped on the named graph of the ELITA lexicon, which extends LiITA with emotion annotations
  GRAPH <http://w3id.org/elita> {

        # Select resources typed as Emotion in the ELITA ontology
        ?emotion rdf:type elita:Emotion .

        # Get the human-readable label for each emotion (rdfs:label)
        ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .

        # Link expressions annotated with a given emotion
        ?expression elita:HasEmotion ?emotion .

        # Retrieve the label of the expression (could be a form or lemma in OntoLex-Lemon)
        ?expression rdfs:label ?expressionLabel .

        # Access the polarity resource attached to the expression, per the MARL ontology for sentiment
        ?expression marl:Polarity ?polarity .

        # Get the actual polarity value (likely a numeric score) to be aggregated
        ?expression marl:hasPolarityValue ?polarityValue .

  }
}
nl: What is the average sentiment polarity for each emotion?

nl_variants.generic: What is the average sentiment polarity score for each emotion?
nl_variants.linguist: Could you provide the mean sentiment polarity values associated with each distinct emotion category?
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve the average polarity values for each emotion class instance in the ELITA named graph within the LiITA dataset, utilizing the elita:Emotion class and associated marl:Polarity property values as modeled in OntoLex-Lemon and MARL vocabularies.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query calculates the average sentiment polarity for each different emotion by gathering all expressions linked to each emotion, retrieving their sentiment polarity values, and computing the mean polarity per emotion category within the ELITA extension of the LiITA lexicon.

sparql:
# This query retrieves words from the LiITA knowledge base that are associated with both the emotions 'gioia' and 'tristezza', utilizing OntoLex-Lemon structures for lemmas and lexical entries.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX elita: <http://w3id.org/elita/>
PREFIX marl: <http://www.gsi.upm.es/ontologies/marl/ns#>

SELECT DISTINCT  ?wr
WHERE {
  # Target the LiITA dataset graph containing Italian linguistic data
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Find resources typed as Lemmas according to the LILA ontology (specific to LiITA)
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Obtain the written representation (the word form) of the lemma, via OntoLex's writtenRep property
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
  }
  # Locate a lexical entry that has the lemma as its canonical form (OntoLex lexicalEntry -> canonicalForm)
  ?l ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma .
  # Get the lexical entry's label (human-readable form)
  ?l rdfs:label ?expressionLabel .

  # Link the lexical entry to emotions it expresses using the elita:HasEmotion property
  ?l elita:HasEmotion ?emotion . 
  # Retrieve the label of the emotion linked to the lexical entry
  ?emotion rdfs:label ?emotionLabel .
  # Filter emotions to those matching 'gioia' (joy), case insensitive
   FILTER regex(str(?emotionLabel), "gioia", "i") .

  # Similarly, link the same lexical entry to a second emotion (?emotion1)
  ?l elita:HasEmotion ?emotion1 .
  # Get the label of this second emotion
  ?emotion1 rdfs:label ?emotion1Label .
  # Filter emotions to those matching 'tristezza' (sadness), case insensitive
   FILTER regex(str(?emotion1Label), "tristezza", "i") .  
} 
LIMIT 100
nl: Find words that express both 'gioia' (joy) and 'tristezza' (sadness)

nl_variants.linguist: Identify Italian lemmas that semantically express the emotions 'gioia' and 'tristezza' simultaneously.

sparql:
# This query retrieves Italian nouns and their Sicilian translations
# where the grammatical gender differs between the two languages.

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

# Select Italian and Sicilian word forms together with their grammatical genders
SELECT DISTINCT ?italianWord ?italianGender ?sicilianWord ?sicilianGender
WHERE {
    # Retrieve Italian lemmas that are nouns
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma ;
                 lila:hasPOS lila:noun ;
                 dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/lemma/LemmaBank> ;
                 ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
    
    # Link the Italian lemma to its lexical entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    
    # Retrieve the grammatical gender of the Italian lemma
    ?italianLemma lila:hasGender ?italianGender .
    
    # Find Sicilian lexical forms that are translations of the Italian lexical entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry vartrans:translatableAs ?sicilianForm .
    
    # Access the Sicilian canonical lemma from the translation relation
    ?sicilianForm ontolex:canonicalForm ?sicilianLemma .
    
    # Ensure the lemma belongs to the Sicilian Lemma Bank and retrieve its written form
    ?sicilianLemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank> ;
                   ontolex:writtenRep ?sicilianWord .
    
    # Retrieve the grammatical gender of the Sicilian lemma
    ?sicilianLemma lila:hasGender ?sicilianGender .
    
    # Keep only pairs where Italian and Sicilian genders are different
    FILTER(?italianGender != ?sicilianGender)
}

# Order the results alphabetically by the Italian word form
ORDER BY ?italianWord

# Limit the output to 1000 results
LIMIT 1000
nl: # This query retrieves Italian nouns and their Sicilian translations where the grammatical gender differs between the two languages.

nl_variants.generic: Find Italian nouns and their Sicilian equivalents where the grammatical gender in Italian is different from the grammatical gender in Sicilian.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian noun lemmas together with their Sicilian translations, selecting only those cases in which the nouns grammatical gender differs between Italian and Sicilian.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Select Italian noun lemmas from the LiITA Italian Lemma Bank, linked via OntoLex-Lemon lexical entries and vartrans:translatableAs relations to Sicilian lemmas in the Sicilian Lemma Bank, and return only those lemma pairs where the lila:hasGender value differs between the two lexical resources.
nl_variants.pedagogical: The query looks for nouns in Italian and their corresponding translations in Sicilian. For each Italian noun, it checks the grammatical gender assigned in Italian and compares it with the gender of the translated Sicilian noun. Only those noun pairs where the gender is not the same in the two languages are included in the results.

sparql:
# Retrieve Italian nouns that can have more than one grammatical gender

PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

# Select Italian lemmas, their written form, and the number of genders associated with each
SELECT DISTINCT ?italianLemma ?italianWord COUNT(?italianGender) AS ?genders
WHERE {
    # Retrieve Italian lemmas that are nouns and belong to the main Italian Lemma Bank
    ?italianLemma a lila:Lemma ;
                 lila:hasPOS lila:noun ;
                 dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/lemma/LemmaBank> ;
                 ontolex:writtenRep ?italianWord .
    
    # Link each lemma to its lexical entry
    ?italianLexicalEntry ontolex:canonicalForm ?italianLemma .
    
    # Retrieve all grammatical gender values associated with the Italian lemma
    ?italianLemma lila:hasGender ?italianGender .
}
# Group results by lemma and written form to count genders per lemma
GROUP BY ?italianLemma ?italianWord

# Keep only lemmas that are associated with more than one distinct gender
HAVING (COUNT(DISTINCT ?italianGender) > 1)

# Order results alphabetically by the written form
ORDER BY ?italianWord

# Limit the output to 1000 results
LIMIT 1000

nl_variants.pedagogical: This query identifies Italian nouns that can appear with more than one grammatical gender. It looks at each Italian noun, counts how many different gender values are recorded for it, and returns only those nouns for which more than one gender is attested.

sparql:
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

# Count the total number of matching nouns
SELECT COUNT(*) as ?count
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Find all lemmas
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .

    ?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:noun .

nl_variants.pedagogical: This query counts Italian nouns that end with the suffix -ione (a common derivational suffix in Italian, similar to English -tion). It filters all lemmas to find only nouns and then checks if their written form ends with 'ione', returning the total count.

sparql:
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

# Return lemma URIs and their written forms
SELECT ?lemma ?wr
WHERE {
  GRAPH <http://liita.it/data> {
    # Find all lemmas
    ?lemma a lila:Lemma .
    # Get the written representation
    ?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
    # Filter for words starting with "infra"
    FILTER regex(str(?wr), "^infra") .
  }
}
nl: Lemmas starting in infra-

nl_variants.generic: Show me all Italian words that start with the prefix infra-.
nl_variants.linguist: List all lemmas beginning with the prefix 'infra-' along with their written forms.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all lila:Lemma instances and their ontolex:writtenRep values from the LiITA graph where the written representation matches the pattern '^infra'.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query finds all Italian lemmas whose written form begins with 'infra-' (like 'infrastruttura', 'infrarosso'). It searches through all lemmas in the database and returns both the lemma identifier and its actual written form for any word starting with this prefix.

sparql:
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX onto: <http://www.ontotext.com/>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
SELECT ?liitaLemma ?lemma ?parmigianoLemma ?wr ?definition WHERE
{
  # Query the external CompL-IT SPARQL endpoint
  SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
    # Find a word that is an instance of ontolex:Word
    ?word a ontolex:Word ;
  # Get the part of speech label of the word
  lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos ] ;
                         # Get the sense (meaning) associated with the word
                         ontolex:sense ?sense ;
                         # Get the canonical form of the word
                         ontolex:canonicalForm ?form .
    # Get the written representation (spelling) of the canonical form
    ?form ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma .
    # Optionally retrieve the definition of the sense (if it exists)
    OPTIONAL {
      ?sense skos:definition ?definition 
    } .
    # Optionally retrieve an example usage of the sense (if it exists)
    OPTIONAL {
      ?sense lexinfo:senseExample ?example 
    } .
    # Filter to include only nouns
    FILTER(str(?pos) = "noun") .
    # Filter to include only definitions that start with "uccello" (bird)
    FILTER (strstarts(str(?definition), "uccello")).
  }
  # Link the CompL-IT word to its LiITA lemma via the canonical form
  ?word ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma.
  # Find the Italian lexicon entry in the Parmigiano dialect that has this LiITA lemma as its canonical form
  ?leItaLexiconPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma;
                   # Verify that this entry belongs to the Parmigiano Lexicon (using inverse property path)
                   ^lime:entry <http://liita.it/data/id/LexicalReources/DialettoParmigiano/Lexicon>.
  # Find the corresponding Parmigiano translation via the translatableAs relation
  ?leItaLexiconPar vartrans:translatableAs ?leParLexiconPar.
  # Get the canonical form (lemma) of the Parmigiano translation
  ?leParLexiconPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?parmigianoLemma.
  # Get the written representation (spelling) of the Parmigiano lemma
  ?parmigianoLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr
}  
# Group results by the Parmigiano written representation to avoid duplicates
group by ?wr
nl: Find all Italian entries linked to CompL-IT where the definition starts with the word "uccello", and show its translation in the Parmigian Glossary

nl_variants.generic: Find all Italian words whose definition starts with 'uccello' (bird) and show their Parmigiano dialect translations.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve Italian nominal entries from the computational lexicon whose definitions begin with 'uccello', together with their corresponding translations in the Parmigiano variety.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query the CompL-IT SERVICE endpoint for ontolex:Word instances with part of speech 'noun' whose skos:definition starts with 'uccello', then follow the ontolex:canonicalForm link to LiITA lemmas and traverse the vartrans:translatableAs relation through the Parmigiano Lexicon to retrieve dialect translations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query connects to an external Italian computational lexicon to find nouns defined as types of birds (definitions starting with 'uccello'). For each match, it traces the connections through the LiITA database to find how these words are translated in the Parmigiano dialect, returning the Italian standard form, the dialect translation, and the original definition.

sparql:
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX onto: <http://www.ontotext.com/>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

# Return hyponym senses with concatenated definitions
SELECT ?senseHyponym (GROUP_CONCAT(str(?_definition);SEPARATOR="; esempio: ") AS ?definition) ?liitaLemma ?parmigianoLemma ?wr
WHERE
   {
     # Query the external CompL-IT SPARQL endpoint
     SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
       # Find all words in CompL-IT with their properties
       ?word a ontolex:Word ;
             lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos ] ;
             ontolex:sense ?sense ;
             ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
       # Find hyponyms (more specific terms) of this sense
       ?sense lexinfo:hypernym ?senseHyponym .
       # Optionally get the definition of the hyponym
       OPTIONAL {
         ?senseHyponym skos:definition ?_definition 
       } .
       # Filter for nouns only
       FILTER(str(?pos) = "noun") .
       # Filter for the lemma "colore" (color)
       FILTER(str(?lemma) = "colore") .
       # Get the word associated with the hyponym sense
       ?wordHyponym ontolex:sense ?senseHyponym .
     } 
     # Link the CompL-IT hyponym word to LiITA lemma
     ?wordHyponym ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma.
     # Find the Italian lexicon entry in Parmigiano dialect
     ?leItaLexiconPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma;
                   ^lime:entry <http://liita.it/data/id/LexicalReources/DialettoParmigiano/Lexicon>.
     # Find the corresponding Parmigiano translation
     ?leItaLexiconPar vartrans:translatableAs ?leParLexiconPar.
     # Get the Parmigiano lemma
     ?leParLexiconPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?parmigianoLemma.
     # Get the written form in Parmigiano
     ?parmigianoLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr
   }  
# Group results to concatenate definitions
GROUP BY ?senseHyponym ?liitaLemma ?parmigianoLemma ?wr
# Sort alphabetically by Parmigiano written form
ORDER BY ASC(?wr)
nl: Retrieves the Parmigiano and LiITA lemmas of the hyponyms of the lemma 'colore' in CompL-it

nl_variants.generic: Find all the specific types of colors and show their translations in Parmigiano dialect.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the hyponyms of 'colore' (i.e., specific color terms subordinate to the hypernym 'color') along with their standard Italian and Parmigiano dialect forms.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query CompL-IT for noun senses that are lexinfo:hypernym of 'colore' sense, retrieve the associated ontolex:Word instances, link them to LiITA canonical forms, and traverse vartrans:translatableAs through the Parmigiano Lexicon to obtain dialect translations, grouping and concatenating definitions.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query finds all specific color terms (like 'rosso', 'blu', 'verde') that are more specific types of the general concept 'colore'. It searches the computational lexicon for words that have a hierarchical relationship with 'colore', then retrieves both their standard Italian forms and their translations in the Parmigiano dialect, along with any available definitions.

sparql:
PREFIX lime: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/lime#>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX onto: <http://www.ontotext.com/>
PREFIX lexinfo: <http://www.lexinfo.net/ontology/3.0/lexinfo#>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

# Return meronym senses with concatenated definitions
SELECT ?senseMeronym (GROUP_CONCAT(str(?_definition);SEPARATOR="; esempio: ") AS ?definition) ?liitaLemma ?parmigianoLemma ?wr
WHERE
   {
     # Query the external CompL-IT SPARQL endpoint
     SERVICE <https://klab.ilc.cnr.it/graphdb-compl-it/> {
       # Find all words in CompL-IT with their properties
       ?word a ontolex:Word ;
             lexinfo:partOfSpeech [ rdfs:label ?pos ] ;
             ontolex:sense ?sense ;
             ontolex:canonicalForm [ ontolex:writtenRep ?lemma ] .
      # Find meronyms (parts) of this sense
      ?senseMeronym lexinfo:partMeronym ?sense .
       # Optionally get the definition of the meronym
       OPTIONAL {
         ?senseMeronym skos:definition ?_definition 
       } .
       # Filter for nouns only
       FILTER(str(?pos) = "noun") .
       # Filter for the lemma "giorno" (day)
       FILTER(str(?lemma) = "giorno") .
       # Get the word associated with the meronym sense
       ?wordMeronym ontolex:sense ?senseMeronym .
     } 
     # Link the CompL-IT meronym word to LiITA lemma
     ?wordMeronym ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma.
     # Find the Italian lexicon entry in Parmigiano dialect
     ?leItaLexiconPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma;
                   ^lime:entry <http://liita.it/data/id/LexicalReources/DialettoParmigiano/Lexicon>.
     # Find the corresponding Parmigiano translation
     ?leItaLexiconPar vartrans:translatableAs ?leParLexiconPar.
     # Get the Parmigiano lemma
     ?leParLexiconPar ontolex:canonicalForm ?parmigianoLemma.
     # Get the written form in Parmigiano
     ?parmigianoLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr
   }  
# Group results to concatenate definitions
GROUP BY ?senseMeronym ?liitaLemma ?parmigianoLemma ?wr
# Sort alphabetically by Parmigiano written form
ORDER BY ASC(?wr)
nl: Retrieves the Parmigiano and LiITA lemmas corresponding to the meronyms of the lemma 'giorno' in CompL-it

nl_variants.generic: Find all the parts or divisions of a day and show their translations in Parmigiano dialect.
nl_variants.linguist: Retrieve the meronyms of 'giorno' (i.e., temporal units or parts that constitute a day) along with their standard Italian and Parmigiano dialect forms.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Query CompL-IT for noun senses that have 'giorno' sense as their lexinfo:partMeronym (i.e., senses representing parts of 'giorno'), retrieve associated ontolex:Word instances, link to LiITA canonical forms, and traverse vartrans:translatableAs through the Parmigiano Lexicon to obtain dialect translations.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query finds all terms that represent parts or divisions of a day (like 'mattina', 'pomeriggio', 'sera'). It searches the computational lexicon for words that have a part-whole relationship with 'giorno' (day), then retrieves both their standard Italian forms and their translations in the Parmigiano dialect, along with any available definitions.

sparql:
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>

# Return Sicilian lemmas with both alternating forms
SELECT ?lemmaSiciliano ?lemmaSicilianoLabel ?wr1 ?wr2
WHERE {
# Filter for lemmas in the Sicilian dialect lemma bank
?lemmaSiciliano dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank>.
# Get the label of the lemma
?lemmaSiciliano rdfs:label ?lemmaSicilianoLabel.
# Get two different written representations
?lemmaSiciliano ontolex:writtenRep ?wr1, ?wr2 .
# Ensure the two representations are different
filter( ?wr1 != ?wr2 ).
# First form must contain "ied"
FILTER regex(str(?wr1), "ied") .
# Second form must contain "ed"
FILTER regex(str(?wr2), "ed") .
} group by ?lemmaSiciliano
nl: Retrieves all Sicilian lemmas having written representations containing the alternation "ed"-"ied"

nl_variants.generic: Find all Sicilian words that have two spelling variants, one with 'ed' and another with 'ied'.
nl_variants.linguist: List all Sicilian lemmas exhibiting orthographic alternation between 'ed' and 'ied' forms.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all lemmas from the DialettoSiciliano lemma bank that have at least two distinct ontolex:writtenRep values, one matching the pattern 'ied' and another matching 'ed'.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query identifies Sicilian dialect words that can be written in two different ways, specifically where one spelling contains the sequence 'ied' and another contains 'ed'. This helps document spelling variation in the Sicilian dialect. The query returns the lemma, its label, and both spelling variants.

sparql:
PREFIX lila: <http://lila-erc.eu/ontologies/lila/>
PREFIX ontolex: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/ontolex#>
PREFIX dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
PREFIX vartrans: <http://www.w3.org/ns/lemon/vartrans#>
# Select the Sicilian lemma, its written forms (concatenated), the Italian lemma, and its written forms (concatenated)
SELECT ?lemma (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?wr ;separator=", ") as ?wrs) ?liitaLemma (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?wrIT ;separator=", ") as ?wrsIT)
WHERE {
# Find lemmas that are part of the Sicilian dialect lemma bank
?lemma dcterms:isPartOf <http://liita.it/data/id/DialettoSiciliano/lemma/LemmaBank>.
# Get the written representation (spelling) of the Sicilian lemma
?lemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wr .
# Filter to include only nouns
?lemma lila:hasPOS lila:noun .
# Find the lexical entry that has this Sicilian lemma as its canonical form
?le ontolex:canonicalForm ?lemma.
# Find the Italian lexical entry that is translatable from the Sicilian entry
?leITA vartrans:translatableAs ?le;
# Get the canonical form (lemma) of the Italian translation
ontolex:canonicalForm ?liitaLemma.
# Get the written representation (spelling) of the Italian lemma
?liitaLemma ontolex:writtenRep ?wrIT.
# Filter to include only Sicilian words ending with "a"
FILTER regex(str(?wr), "a$") .
} 
# Group results by Sicilian lemma and Italian lemma to aggregate multiple written forms
group by ?lemma ?liitaLemma
nl: Retrieves Sicilian common nouns ending with the abstract suffix "a" and show the correspoding Italian translations

nl_variants.generic: Find all Sicilian nouns ending in -a and their Italian translations.
nl_variants.linguist: List all Sicilian nominal lemmas exhibiting the abstract derivational suffix -a along with their standard Italian correspondents.
nl_variants.linked_data_expert: Retrieve all lila:noun instances from the DialettoSiciliano lemma bank whose ontolex:writtenRep matches 'a$', link them through vartrans:translatableAs to their Italian translation lemmas, and display both Sicilian and Italian written forms.
nl_variants.pedagogical: This query finds Sicilian nouns ending with the suffix -a (which often forms abstract nouns, similar to English -y or -ness) and retrieves their corresponding Italian translations. It searches the Sicilian dialect database, filters for nouns with this ending, and connects them to their standard Italian equivalents.
